[{'created': '2016-09-01 16:25:03.000000000', 'message': "osc node power on & off commands

This replaces 'openstack baremetal node power <on|off>' with two
explicit commands: 'openstack baremetal node power on' and
'openstack baremetal node power off'.

The two commands are more in line with openstackclient guidelines.
There is no change to the user issuing the power command (the actual
command line is the same). However, help and lists (e.g. via
'openstack -h baremetal') will show the individual power commands.

Change-Id: I39ab81e148ca28ce24d402106228fb5dd2f6d60e
Closes-Bug: #1619363

commit_message:
osc node power on & off commands

This replaces 'openstack baremetal node power <on|off>' with
the two commands: 'openstack baremetal node power on' and
'openstack baremetal node power off'.

The two commands are more in line with openstackclient guidelines.
There is no change to the user issuing the power command (the actual
command line is the same). However, help and lists (e.g. via
'openstack -h baremetal') will show the individual power commands.

Change-Id: I39ab81e148ca28ce24d402106228fb5dd2f6d60e
Closes-Bug: #1619363

As the original author of the patch I confirm that this fix dramatically improves load speed for Admin->Volumes when there are many volumes owned by a different tenant (not the one currently activated in Horizon).
Real env case, ~ 240 volumes - load time decreased from 43 seconds to 8 seconds.'}, {'account_id': 12281, 'date': '2015-11-30 12:55:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

IMO this should be fixed in api.nova.server_list instead.

It should not receive 2 different parameters as all_tenants should be in the search_opts.

The problem seem to lie in that it will add the all_tenants parameter to the search + the tenant_id due to both parameters being use. In any case it should check if all_tenants in search_opts and add it to the search else use tenant_id in the search_opts.'}, {'account_id': 8040, 'date': '2015-12-22 17:56:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

nova.server_list() behaves here the same way as neutron api wrappers. So I'm not sure it's the Nova here who breaks the rules. Perhaps it's just Cinder doing things in non uniform way? 

Besides that, changing Nova method signature would require us to rewrite a lot of tests :(."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-03-16 13:19:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

commit_message:
Get all needed instances for volumes attachments at Admin->Volumes

Nova server_list() wrapper needs to receive an explicit `all_tenants`
boolean flag in order to request instances for _all_ tenants -
otherwise while rendering Admin->Volumes table Django will request
missing instances (to get their names for volume attachments) one by
one, thus significantly increasing response time.

This patch adds check if all_tenants in search_opts and add it to
the search else uses tenant_id in the search_opts.

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Sutyagin <dsutyagin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ivan Kolodyazhny <e0ne@e0ne.info>
Change-Id: I4761d7da15036b69619649871aef91e1799ee385
Closes-Bug: #1508568

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-14 17:00:45.000000000', 'message': 'Catch socket.timeout when doing heartbeat_check

heartbeat_check in kombu.connection is not reraising exceptions as
exceptions.OperationalError, and the socket timeout during the heartbeat
check is really an issue seen in the field when a node goes down; the
heartbeat thread just tries again and again to deal with it, without
success.

Change-Id: I26dbdb18a7e64946db2cba676764ff2d428c7897
Closes-Bug: #1657444
'}]
commit_message:
Catch socket.timeout when doing heartbeat_check

heartbeat_check in kombu.connection is not reraising exceptions as
exceptions.OperationalError, and the socket timeout during the heartbeat
check is really an issue seen in the field when a node goes down; the
heartbeat thread just tries again and again to deal with it, without
success.

Change-Id: I26dbdb18a7e64946db2cba676764ff2d428c7897
Closes-Bug: #1657444

[{'created': '2017-11-13 18:07:33.000000000', 'message': '[DNM] Test test_delete failure

Change-Id: I9160c503183a1d909dfcfe67eba0e27ae3499a14
'}, {'created': '2017-11-13 22:32:07.000000000', 'message': 'Wait for container deletion in tests

Container deletion was changed from sync to async. If users submit a
request to delete a container, server will response immediately but
the container might not be deleted right away. Users should not assume
the container is deleted unless the container is not shown up in list.

Therefore, the tempest test case need to be updated to deal with this
change. After the delete request is issued, we add logic to wait for
the container to disappear before doing the assertion. This should
fix the intermittent failure of the gate.

Change-Id: I9160c503183a1d909dfcfe67eba0e27ae3499a14
'}]
commit_message:
Wait for container deletion in tests

Container deletion was changed from sync to async. If users submit a
request to delete a container, server will response immediately but
the container might not be deleted right away. Users should not assume
the container is deleted unless the container is not shown up in list.

Therefore, the tempest test case need to be updated to deal with this
change. After the delete request is issued, we add logic to wait for
the container to disappear before doing the assertion. This should
fix the intermittent failure of the gate.

Change-Id: I9160c503183a1d909dfcfe67eba0e27ae3499a14

commit_message:
Add argument 'mounts' to container

Introduce an option for users to bind-mount Cinder volumes to
containers. The syntax will look like:

  $ zun run --mount source=my-volume,destination=/data <image>

The above command will bind-mount cinder volume with name 'my-volume'
into path '/data' inside the container.

Change-Id: If8e44527e65cf574400b9043108e75b473b3627c
Partial-Implements: blueprint direct-cinder-integration

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-14 19:00:39.000000000', 'message': "Add missing dns_domain to pike's neutron.conf template

Neutron ML2 DNS integration was broken in pike deployments due
to the dns_domain name not changing from the default openstacklocal.
This change adds the dns_domain option into the neutron.conf file.

Change-Id: I9ea25ab7f1a30a1a172d0d33c4d408712b66de0a
Closes-Bug: 1732042
"}]
commit_message:
Add missing dns_domain to pike's neutron.conf template

Neutron ML2 DNS integration was broken in pike deployments due
to the dns_domain name not changing from the default openstacklocal.
This change adds the dns_domain option into the neutron.conf file.

Change-Id: I9ea25ab7f1a30a1a172d0d33c4d408712b66de0a
Closes-Bug: 1732042

commit_message:
Fix displaying pool name for floating ip

It fixes an issue when pool name is not
displayed for floating ip in a case when any
floating ip is not associated with an instance.

Change-Id: Ic20ec3709fa7c5313f59a16aa32b975eb004f753
Closes-Bug: #1716431

commit_message:
Ensure that venv is used

This is to ensure that the charm doesn't trample on system packages
for the things that it needs to install.
Particularly, the problem is with subordinates.

Also a fix for new E722 pep8 standard set.

Change-Id: I72e25c518298d7ac56fc3401118a0c2951ef069c

commit_message:
Do not fail on AdminUpdateRow if tenant is not found

We still can show instance info on admin/instances page even if tenant
is deleted or we can't retrieve tenant's information.

Change-Id: Idb1a5ffbb4103cce5258657d559bf4fe784b98d6
Closes-Bug: #1712565

I'm stepping down from this patch maintenance. 

We've got not a good test coverage. I don't see a lot of patches that implement only new tests There are a lot of bugs are in launchpad. There are a lot of untested code in the repo.

 And if somebody doesn't want to have bug-fix merged with not ideal test coverage - it's up to community to decide what to do with this bug and patch"}, {'account_id': 15637, 'date': '2017-08-23 16:31:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

Ivan, this is exactly the reason I dropped maintenance of this and another bugfixes'}, {'account_id': 8478, 'date': '2017-08-28 13:06:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

Matthias, we must find a compromise. As we all know, the OpenStack community is not active now as it was before, and we have a lot of bugs that do not close for more than a year. If we follow the same strict policy regarding single tests or other things, we will not move forward and we will not develop our project.'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2017-08-28 18:21:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 31:

commit_message:
Fix actions inside instance details view page

At the current moment user can not suspend an
instance from the instance "Details" page if the
instance does not belong to the first page of the
instances list. This is fixed.

Co-Authored-By: Ivan Kolodyazhny <e0ne@e0ne.info>
Co-Authored-By: Vladislav Kuzmin <vkuzmin@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I4d805e4a65e838242af38677cbb9efefc498a96f
Closes-Bug: #1553142

commit_message:
Get host info without specifying segment

This patch added a feature to get host info without specifying
segment. With this patch, the user does not need to specify
segment id or name when executing host show subcommand, and
specifying it is optional.

Change-Id: I93b7a29a20edf3f5f68ad94458f913312c7107bc
Implements: bp find-segment-by-host

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see

at

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I1b78e9a42a1e58ffba2a88f2aaeb07b2fad78684

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I40b57b57974dc5f1abc8fa10e41b9f29b8ea7ab6

commit_message:
OOB RAID configuration for ilo5 based HPE Proliant Servers

This spec adds support for out-of-band raid configuration
for redfish compliant HPE Proliant servers.

Change-Id: Ia10fff0ba2bf29e319bc20f01ab028fb2db16f6a

commit_message:
Remove neutron.common.ipv6_utils.is_enabled()

is_enabled() was marked deprecated for Pike and all in-tree
users have been changed, remove it.

Change-Id: If087fc7e138f8302882e26550ea3e2abc521da9a

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-16 09:47:46.000000000', 'message': 'Implement policy in code - reno and doc (end)

This commit migrate all policies into code [1].

Like oslo.config, with oslo.policy, we can define all of
default rules in code base and only change some rules
via policy file. Another thing that we should use yaml
format instead of json format.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html
Co-authored-By: Dai Dang-Van <daidv@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: If99f6e33145dee43315f0cb4234478de2267a20a

commit_message:
Implement policy in code - reno and doc (end)

This commit migrate all policies into code [1].

Like oslo.config, with oslo.policy, we can define all of
default rules in code base and only change some rules
via policy file. Another thing that we should use yaml
format instead of json format.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html
Co-authored-By: Dai Dang-Van <daidv@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: If99f6e33145dee43315f0cb4234478de2267a20a

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: Ic6736090262d7e681086f807eb8bf3782b6fcfa0

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

The JSON formatter used to rely on services making their logging calls
and passing the context there. A call it expted would be

    LOG.debug("Some message", context=context)

This would end up in the "extra" section of the logging record. This is
not usually the case, as projects don't always pass the context on that
call. This also applies to the Fluent formatter which is based on the
JSON one.

For the JSON formatter, we already are getting the context from the

'extra' section. Finally, this places the context in its own section,

commit_message:
Capture context in its own key for JSON-based formatters

The JSON formatter used to rely on services making their logging calls
and passing the context there. A call it expted would be

    LOG.debug("Some message", context=context)

This would end up in the "extra" section of the logging record. This is
not usually the case, as projects don't always pass the context on that
call. This also applies to the Fluent formatter which is based on the
JSON one.

For the JSON formatter, we already are getting the context from the
record. So lets use that if no context was provided in the record's
'extra' section. Finally, this places the context in its own section,
which is named 'context'.

Closes-Bug: #1730329
Depends-On: I2b245c1665c3587be3c476b803122788d186e5d5
Change-Id: I765dae17d2ecadce1672f16e432e748d5233acf8

commit_message:
Debug configuration for neutron metadata agent

The neutron metadata agent isn't currently configured for debug when the
global debug flag is enabled. Additionally add a flag to just configure
debug for the metadata agent itself.

Change-Id: I7ef636b8ad4c6fe4f05970c41c05d522a0f0d892
Related-Bug: #1731063

commit_message:
Dynamically generate FQDN hiera entries

These were hardcoded, even though the rest of the network-related bits
were already dynamically generated with jinja.

Change-Id: I8b9e36cbc355065a9117b0a5c5b46afd6ee25d58
Closes-Bug: #1732457

commit_message:
Drop step_config as top level docker requirement

Step config is only required within the puppet_configs section
of docker/services/*. This patch drops the top level 'step_config'
and updates the unit tests accordingly.

Change-Id: I7dc7cfae3ef1965ec95b1d9ef23e7f162418c034

'}, {'created': '2017-11-15 19:51:06.000000000', 'message': "Import TripleO legacy zuul jobs

- Import tripleo-buildimage playbooks and refactorize.
  Note: tripleo_image_type var was created to re-use the
  same playbooks.
- Import toci_ci playbooks and refactorize.
  Note: some vars were created to re-use the same playbooks.
- Import jobs, templates and projects layouts.
  Sort jobs by type so it's easily understable.
- Create new templates and use these templates in tripleo-ci.
  It will make projects layouts easy.

commit_message:
Import TripleO legacy zuul jobs

- Import tripleo-buildimage playbooks and refactorize.
  Note: tripleo_image_type var was created to re-use the
  same playbooks.
- Import toci_ci playbooks and refactorize.
  Note: some vars were created to re-use the same playbooks.
- Import jobs, templates and projects layouts.
  Sort jobs by type so it's easily understable.
- Create new templates and use these templates in tripleo-ci.
  It will make projects layouts easy.

Change-Id: Ie8aa85fe7a8ee556cc1b46e215d329e95913290c
Co-Authored-By: David Moreau-Simard <dms@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I7cedd7fefa72e065372458a4b9d3b24b0d0f3778

commit_message:
Allow the configuration of image_member_quota from THT

Allow the configuration of image_member_quota
in Glance API. This error blocks the ability
of sharing images if the default value (128)
is reached.

Closes-bug: 1724879
Depends-on: Idc72c85943baf3d720500d2c30a813663f2927da
Change-Id: I6a3d4d9666378bbc5610d96bcedc81cf4c5d7de7
(cherry picked from commit b9500bcb331ced7e90ee50dede74c85ecf9c71b8)

subject: Don't index karaf logs
messages: [{'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2017-11-16 23:51:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-11-17 05:13:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2017-11-17 08:07:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 23:51:58.000000000', 'message': "Don't index karaf logs

The screen-karaf.txt logs come in at a ~270MB, are not in oslo log
format, and don't filter by log level. Attempting to index this file has
OOM'd at least one logstash worker process. We didn't attempt to index
these files prior to the zuulv3 switch so lets just stop indexing them.

Change-Id: Iaab5883c9af9c5d0b323fc351c92869bde7edb9d
"}]
commit_message:
Don't index karaf logs

The screen-karaf.txt logs come in at a ~270MB, are not in oslo log
format, and don't filter by log level. Attempting to index this file has
OOM'd at least one logstash worker process. We didn't attempt to index
these files prior to the zuulv3 switch so lets just stop indexing them.

Change-Id: Iaab5883c9af9c5d0b323fc351c92869bde7edb9d

commit_message:
DHCP port per network

Until this patch dhcp_port created per subnet
This patch change this behaviour to - one port per network

For full details see :
https://github.com/openstack/dragonflow/blob/master/doc/source/specs/dhcp_port_per_network.rst

Change-Id: I25c6a6876945c9e6ee10887e8900564692455258
Closes-Bug: #1725983
Closes-Bug: #1531377

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I6a47a0c7bfacf38818c13b1304d13c0c4de71436

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I107c477f3fead667f5e0c0f5e2c4adc5221e2195

commit_message:
Fix the deprecated syntax in 01-rewrite.conf

The current syntax of Ubuntu fluentd rewrite rules are not supported
anymore, reference to this commit[1].
According to the build of this patch[2], The Centos has no such isuue.
Only Ubuntu needs to be upgrade to use the <rule> section.

* Centos use 01-rewrite-0.12.conf.j2
* Ubuntu use 01-rewrite-0.14.conf.j2

backport: pike

[1] https://github.com/fluent/fluent-plugin-rewrite-tag-filter/commit/248ed8e97def0a60121199c0d0e2fa8785f0d076
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517907

Depends-on: I47985113fe732569d640a262ca832c6edc8c2bb6
Change-Id: I0b131c2f65652cf3c61b33d8162097b047603923
Closes-Bug: #1730664

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-17 07:08:47.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is
entirely due to the current convention of pulling in the version
information. Release notes should not need installation in order
to build, so this unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.
This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion
starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html

Change-Id: I84c83562aee9f98692ade2404e17e0998ce7f49a
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is
entirely due to the current convention of pulling in the version
information. Release notes should not need installation in order
to build, so this unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.
This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion
starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html

Change-Id: I84c83562aee9f98692ade2404e17e0998ce7f49a

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 22406, 'date': '2017-10-25 03:22:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Correct me if I'm wrong, but I think it's a valid use case like
 > what `SHADE_TOX_PYTHON` been handled in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/500365/34/.zuul.yaml

I'm not sure SHADE_TOX_PYTHON was used in playbooks. A quick search [1]. After define in .zuul.yaml, we still need to call something like "{{ heat_environment.DEVSTACK_GATE_TOPOLOGY }}" to use it.

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=SHADE_TOX_PYTHON&i=nope&files=&repos='}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2017-10-25 03:37:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

According to Shade's legacy jobs definition (like in [1]).
I think it was part of Ansible playbook for Shade and also no need to call it with `heat_environemnt` to export it

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508757/1/playbooks/legacy/shade-functional-libs-py35/run.yaml"}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2017-10-25 04:27:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 22406, 'date': '2017-10-25 04:28:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

> According to Shade's legacy jobs definition (like in [1]).
 > I think it was part of Ansible playbook for Shade and also no need
 > to call it with `heat_environemnt` to export it
 > 
 > [1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508757/1/playbooks/legacy/shade-functional-libs-py35/run.yaml

Monty Taylor replaced shade_environment with tox_environment but he missed one. For e.x: L112 [1]. tox_environment is a dict which is used in [2].
I don't think *_environment can do the magic itself. We still need to use it explicitly.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/500365/30..34/.zuul.yaml

commit_message:
Add upper-constraints stable/pike to test requirements

 Normally, OpenStack Release Bot propose this change [1].
However, masakari did not get that proposal. This is maybe,
when pike released, masakari was not an official project.
This patch propose stable/pike cap for upper-constraints.txt

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/492981/

Needed-By: I2903653a13313b0eee7ba30705a453064b1e4991
Change-Id: Ifc30770a20e819c531d5e85ff3bc8e9be088166d

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-17 06:46:02.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove
version/release values. We've found that projects now
require the service package to be installed in order
to build release notes, and this is entirely due to the
current convention of pulling in the version information.
Release notes should not need installation in order to
build, so this unnecessary version setting needs to be
removed. This is needed for new release notes publishing,see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion
starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I91f66b1450c721f34389e4e2bc8c15370fa242bd
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove
version/release values. We've found that projects now
require the service package to be installed in order
to build release notes, and this is entirely due to the
current convention of pulling in the version information.
Release notes should not need installation in order to
build, so this unnecessary version setting needs to be
removed. This is needed for new release notes publishing,see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion
starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I91f66b1450c721f34389e4e2bc8c15370fa242bd

commit_message:
Update os-refresh/apply/collect-config for pbr compat

Older os-refresh-config had a pin on pbr < 2.0, so this is
the first version that has uncapped pbr, which would otherwise
conflict with any openstack pbr using project. 6.0.0 was released
March 2017, so it isn't a recent new requirement

Change-Id: I94b5f57250eaec1da1df0d116c5b2dceb2d62a00

This includes a fix for a serious bug that can cause operations to
time out.

https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html

(7 comments)

We just did a similar refactor in the trunks panel patches not long ago. So we were thinking of doing this for the images panel too. But you beat us to it.

Overall it looks good to me. I miss one thing. IIRC deprecating initScope served the purpose of making the action services stateless (therefore reusable from multiple callers). For that we would need to get rid of a few variables declared at the top scope (I mean javascript function scope, not angular scope) of the action services. See more comments inline.'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2017-08-31 03:50:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(7 comments)

@Bence, I also had done this for several plugins before Ocata and for forgotten few remainings resently. I'm sorry for wasting your plan. And thank you very much for notifing lots of things to me. I was lazy for confirming deeply. Maybe I was tired remembering old implementations and tons of tests. I think I remove some of initScope and initAction, but they remains... :/"}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2017-08-31 03:51:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-31 04:27:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2017-08-31 09:12:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

> I'm sorry for wasting your plan.

No problem at all. Thanks for doing the work.

 > I think I remove some of initScope and initAction, but they remains... :/

I think it's really good that now you removed not just the calls to initScope but the definition of initScope too, because this way it can't creep back in with new panels.

Also horizon out-of-tree plugins may have used initScope too, but they were warned about the deprecation long ago and now they have a full cycle to adapt. So I think that's graceful."}, {'account_id': 25747, 'date': '2017-09-04 00:26:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14151, 'date': '2017-09-05 09:53:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2017-09-07 08:09:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-07 08:39:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified+1

commit_message:
Remove deprecated scope handling

The `initScope` function is deprecated since ocata, so this patch
replaces it into `initAction` if it needed, or removes it.
Also, gets scope from second parameter of perform function.
Futher more, removes deprecated `scope` parameter for `modal`
function of wizard-modal-service.

Change-Id: I8979b699a9b4383b894db9bdcbad80f15c1df150
Closes-Bug: #1640049

subject: Fail ceph-ansible workflow if there is stale puppet-ceph hieradata
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 12:50:19.000000000', 'message': "Fail ceph-ansible workflow if there is stale puppet-ceph hieradata

We should stop the deployment if there is stale puppet-ceph
hieradata because it isn't converted automatically into
ceph-ansible variables.

Initially we only stop the deployment if ceph::profile::params::osds
is found to make sure operators have converted that into a ceph-ansible
parameter and removed it from the Heat environment file.

Change-Id: I6031625b128b989c78f20350d2971cc61bf874b1
Closes-Bug: #1723085
(cherry picked from commit 8c90ee5d46b6e4d0ebfc032591e0dbeb82589bbb)
"}]
commit_message:
Fail ceph-ansible workflow if there is stale puppet-ceph hieradata

We should stop the deployment if there is stale puppet-ceph
hieradata because it isn't converted automatically into
ceph-ansible variables.

Initially we only stop the deployment if ceph::profile::params::osds
is found to make sure operators have converted that into a ceph-ansible
parameter and removed it from the Heat environment file.

Change-Id: I6031625b128b989c78f20350d2971cc61bf874b1
Closes-Bug: #1723085
(cherry picked from commit 8c90ee5d46b6e4d0ebfc032591e0dbeb82589bbb)

values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely

unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: Ia6d8fbd7792f87e114caad51bfca2cf0ed3dff3e

commit_message:
Update releasenotes publish job

The build job was modified to not use tox in
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8.  Fix up the argument and
don't try to get the tox output that won't exist any more.

Change-Id: I0b470df7b5e9c772a36f25a549a46f059be3a41b

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-15 14:08:05.000000000', 'message': 'Enable httpd to request certificates for the "external" network

Deployers can change the network that a service is running on through
the ServiceNetMap. A common change is to switch the keystone admin API
to run in the external network instead of the ctlplane network. Doing
this in a TLS everywhere environment breaks, since we were explicitly
skipping the external network.

This no longer skips that network, thus enabling this use-case.

Change-Id: I488517528a77a257dede2f59488bb95ffc77743b
Closes-Bug: #1732443
'}]
commit_message:
Enable httpd to request certificates for the "external" network

Deployers can change the network that a service is running on through
the ServiceNetMap. A common change is to switch the keystone admin API
to run in the external network instead of the ctlplane network. Doing
this in a TLS everywhere environment breaks, since we were explicitly
skipping the external network.

This no longer skips that network, thus enabling this use-case.

Change-Id: I488517528a77a257dede2f59488bb95ffc77743b
Closes-Bug: #1732443

Stop using resource_cleanup in identity_v2 tests

Replace resource_cleanup with addClassResourceCleanup in identity
v2 tests.

commit_message:
Use addClassResourceCleanup to clear domains

This is to use addClassResourceCleanup to cleanup
created domains, instead of cleaning them in resource_cleanup.

Change-Id: I9c0bd7b84ffc366bcf8f455f20d7bed30892a88a

commit_message:
Truncate the zaqar message to 512 kbytes

We need to limit this otherwise zaqar will return 400 error as we
are setting a maximum of 1mbyte at [0]. We limit at 256 kbytes
for each of stderr and stdout.

Closes-Bug: 1730663
[0] https://github.com/openstack/instack-undercloud/blob/d60cd845022679f70c382f355bd59f5007210e17/elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template#L681
Change-Id: I1e9a962d7c3e4448163a05c30c8facfe346a4252

commit_message:
Add missing host_prep_tasks for memcached

I missed this in change
Iecce2820657c5ad6bd2b02849c0433e5dce8009b. Memcached seems to be the
only service which mounts the /var/log/container/<service-name>
directory directly under /var/log in the container.

Change-Id: I26928bc7ad5f2f1bed60d200e8f2f0c310a14ee5
Partial-Bug: #1730957
(cherry picked from commit db60db93c626bae029561ba5d3cd838668f6ddc2)

[{'created': '2017-10-24 18:36:32.000000000', 'message': 'Add --output-dir

Add an --output-dir cli arg to be used alongside --config-download. The
arg controls where the downloaded ansible playbooks and log files will
be stored on the local filesystem.

The path must be writeable by the current user and mistral user, so it
will typically need to be pre-created manually with the correct
permissions.

Depends-On: I89b17d0c4f035705fd5230caad06d331fd5b5e76 implements:
blueprint ansible-config-download

commit_message:
Add --output-dir

Add an --output-dir cli arg to be used alongside --config-download. The
arg controls where the downloaded ansible playbooks and log files will
be stored on the local filesystem.

The path must be writeable by the current user and mistral user, so it
will typically need to be pre-created manually with the correct
permissions.

Depends-On: I89b17d0c4f035705fd5230caad06d331fd5b5e76
implements: blueprint ansible-config-download

Change-Id: Iff7a1b211a545f1227b9e13e304b858128fb855b

commit_message:
Add --config-download

Add a new cli option to tripleoclient called --config-download that will
trigger using the config download mechanism to apply the overcloud
configuration via ansible.

When using --config-download, an additional workflow called
tripleo.deployment.v1.config_download_deploy is run after the
deploy_play workflow. This new workflow does the necessary setup and
then executes the software configuration steps via ansible.

Change-Id: If3114a6fda75ee502d80e4ba27b5f2e81ba44085
implements: blueprint ansible-config-download
Depends-On: I738c78b32590c58ae8b721289ad8103ee09e9956

[{'created': '2017-11-16 19:47:12.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: Ia0c8d7dc346182fde095eebb82eeeb70fc1b9770
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: Ia0c8d7dc346182fde095eebb82eeeb70fc1b9770

[{'created': '2017-10-24 18:29:59.000000000', 'message': 'Add work_dir for some actions

The Ansible actions and DownloadConfig actions both relied on a tmp path
for the working files they saved. This is less than ideal as some of
this data could be sensitive so it should not be stored in /tmp.

Also, the path was unpredictable, making things more difficult from a
user perspective.

This patch adds a work_dir input to these actions and makes use of that
input from the config-download workflow. The default behavior when this
input is not supplied is the previous behavior to use a generated path
under /tmp.

Change-Id: I89b17d0c4f035705fd5230caad06d331fd5b5e76

commit_message:
Add work_dir for some actions

The Ansible actions and DownloadConfig actions both relied on a tmp path
for the working files they saved. This is less than ideal as some of
this data could be sensitive so it should not be stored in /tmp.

Also, the path was unpredictable, making things more difficult from a
user perspective.

This patch adds a work_dir input to these actions and makes use of that
input from the config-download-deploy workflow. The default behavior
when this input is not supplied is the previous behavior to use a
generated path under /tmp.

Change-Id: I89b17d0c4f035705fd5230caad06d331fd5b5e76
implements: blueprint ansible-config-download

recheck bug 1732140'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-16 13:16:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1

What permission does the log end up with?'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2017-11-16 13:19:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

> What permission does the log end up with?

it's owned by mistral under /var/lib/mistral.

/var/lib/mistral is currently 755. However, I think we will want to secure it further to be 750 since it will contain passwords. We can then document adding users to the mistral group via sudo if the operator wants them to be able to see the log.

I think this "opt-in" approach is the most secure.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-16 13:39:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-11-16 14:34:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2017-10-24 18:29:59.000000000', 'message': 'Log Ansible actions to ansible.log

Changes the Ansible actions so that they will log to ansible.log in the

commit_message:
use dns domain ports api def from neutron-lib

The dns domain ports extension's API definition was rehomed into
neutron-lib with I79a96e72daa5baf579fcece2a703a47b8059423e
This patch consumes it by removing the rehomed code and using the
APIExtensionDescriptor for the extensions parent class.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I8517a5b7c1ae7f4909f4c9829cf8ddea865f5210

Fix SQLAlchemy reference link

Issue was raised in I20171c815d4718bb90f54b5b4184191118f31fe2 that the link
to the SQLAlchemy reference doc was not correct, but that is outside the
scope for what that patch is addressing.

To address that concern, this changes the link to the current URL.

TrivialFix

subject: Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-11-16 21:34:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-11-16 21:52:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2017-11-17 03:20:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 21:34:24.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I4a41917466fb88a8687c011718f33c75e9374cf6
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I4a41917466fb88a8687c011718f33c75e9374cf6

commit_message:
Revert "openvswitch: Move IP address from physical device to bridge"

This prevents the pod restarting correctly on a node reboot - we need
to find another way to do this.

This reverts commit 27aadd67e05632afb86e97a39f775c0a1cc5f81f.

Change-Id: Id7d4ae94ade99d38729b30d6d2ba7d5385d50a4b

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 21:34:00.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I05fbc7f7808bae7fb1bf1a6b286c36980791d0c4
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I05fbc7f7808bae7fb1bf1a6b286c36980791d0c4

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 01:43:20.000000000', 'message': 'Add nested virtualization support for Ubuntu Xenial ppc64le/ppc64 servers

This patch installs the Xenial HWE kernel for ppc64le and ppc64 servers
via a new post-install.d script in the ubuntu-xenial-guest element

The kernel is conditionally installed when the environment variable
DIB_USE_HWE_KERNEL=true.  This variable is set automatically by trovestack
for integration and gate tests, which uses nested virtualization to run
guest imagess.  It also may be set by the user when manually invoking
disk-image-create to enable nested virtualization if that is desired.

Change-Id: Iaf01c543ea210bd4725ab909aff6884df451b198
'}, {'created': '2017-11-16 16:45:29.000000000', 'message': "Utilize Ubuntu's hardware enablement stack for trovestack

This brings in the latest fixes which is often important for
nested virtualization.  For ppc64el is it required.  The stack
is installed via a new post-install.d script in the
ubuntu-xenial-guest element

A user that is manually creating datastore images may install
this stack by setting the following environment variable prior
to running the disk-image-create command.

export DIB_USE_HWE_KERNEL=true

Change-Id: Iaf01c543ea210bd4725ab909aff6884df451b198
"}, {'created': '2017-11-16 16:48:40.000000000', 'message': "Utilize Ubuntu's hardware enablement stack for trovestack

commit_message:
Utilize Ubuntu's hardware enablement stack for trovestack

This brings in the latest fixes which is often important for
nested virtualization.  It is required for ppc64el.  This stack
is installed via a new post-install.d script in the trove
integration element ubuntu-xenial-guest.

A user that is manually creating datastore images may install
this stack by setting the following environment variable prior
to running the disk-image-create command.

export DIB_USE_HWE_KERNEL=true

Change-Id: Iaf01c543ea210bd4725ab909aff6884df451b198

Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I1d998ff2ec823ce8e412f3323e7b158ee501949d

commit_message:
Fix tempest html generation file

In the latest version of tempest, the testr was replaced by
stestr, and so, the path where these results were stored changed
as well from .testrepository to .stestr. This patch verify which
directory was generated, and execute the subunit2html in the
proper directory.

Change-Id: Ic5a04781f830597a2c5fe9516a704ff5a9b5ff24
Closes-Bug: #1729403

commit_message:
Add job name to recent failed test results

In the post zuul v3 world the job name in the url doesn't always match
the job name in the database. Because of this we need to be returning
the job name from the database in the recent failed tests list so we can
use that for the table.

Change-Id: Ic1ba76c853ffd9ebb87683e56c82fea711b6139b

This surely isn't the only incident of this. As Zaitcev pointed out in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/475280/, we need a way to have this validated in the gate (both so we actually fix the problem entirely and so we don't regress later -- otherwise we'll have an endless slew of these sorts of patches until we actually have a full-coverage py3 gate). I started out wanting to just treat all warnings as errors. But then pip complains (by way of requests, then urllib3):

 SNIMissingWarning: An HTTPS request has been made, but the SNI (Subject Name Indication)
 extension to TLS is not available on this platform. This may cause the server to present
 an incorrect TLS certificate, which can cause validation failures. You can upgrade to a
 newer version of Python to solve this. For more information, see
 https://urllib3.readthedocs.io/en/latest/security.html#snimissingwarning.

And we can't even get as far as running any tests. Well, let's try *only DeprecationWarnings*. Nope; this time pbr complains (by way of setuptools):

 DeprecationWarning: Do not call this function

(IIRC, this is supposed to get fixed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/399188/ but that hasn't seen any new developments in quite some time.)

OK, let's limit it to *just this one thing* by adding

 PYTHONWARNINGS=error:BaseException.message has been deprecated as of Python 2.6:DeprecationWarning

to the setenv in tox.ini. On master, I count 68 failures; with this, we only get down to 57."}, {'account_id': 25456, 'date': '2017-08-18 07:52:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

 > in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/475280/, we need a way to have
 > this validated in the gate (both so we actually fix the problem
 > entirely and so we don't regress later -- otherwise we'll have an
 > endless slew of these sorts of patches until we actually have a
 > full-coverage py3 gate). I started out wanting to just treat all
 > warnings as errors. But then pip complains (by way of requests,
 > then urllib3):
 > 
 > SNIMissingWarning: An HTTPS request has been made, but the SNI
 > (Subject Name Indication)
 > extension to TLS is not available on this platform. This may cause
 > the server to present
 > an incorrect TLS certificate, which can cause validation failures.
 > You can upgrade to a
 > newer version of Python to solve this. For more information, see
 > https://urllib3.readthedocs.io/en/latest/security.html#snimissingwarning.
 > 
 > And we can't even get as far as running any tests. Well, let's try
 > *only DeprecationWarnings*. Nope; this time pbr complains (by way
 > of setuptools):
 > 
 > DeprecationWarning: Do not call this function
 > 
 > (IIRC, this is supposed to get fixed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/399188/
 > but that hasn't seen any new developments in quite some time.)
 > 
 > OK, let's limit it to *just this one thing* by adding
 > 
 > PYTHONWARNINGS=error:BaseException.message has been deprecated as
 > of Python 2.6:DeprecationWarning
 > 
 > to the setenv in tox.ini. On master, I count 68 failures; with
 > this, we only get down to 57.

@ Tim"}, {'account_id': 25456, 'date': '2017-08-18 08:01:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> > This surely isn't the only incident of this. As Zaitcev pointed

@Time
Thanks for your suggestion, it will fix all of this kind of issues and can also prevent people making the same mistake in the future.
I will update this patch and fix them all later."}, {'account_id': 25456, 'date': '2017-11-17 02:38:26.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Unsupported 'message' Exception attribute in PY3

The 'message' attribute has been deprecated in Python 2.6 and remove it in Python3.
For more details, please check [1]:
[1] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0352/#retracted-ideas

Change-Id: I48201e81b43c6c2625fa81deac7b4c91a06d800d

commit_message:
Add --no-rollback option for stack cancel

This adds a new --no-rollback option for stack cancel.

Usage: openstack stack cancel --no-rollback <stack_name>

Change-Id: I46252823701779e3a3c6867bc470d5532cf9d7a7
Related-Bug: #1709041

commit_message:

commit_message:
Add proper message when delete instance or cluster

According bug description, not like nova-delete when use trove-delete
there is no message or alert is generated. To solve this problem, I
added some message when normally execute deleting instance or cluster.

Change-Id: I572a24116fd1abec220f49a3f9705a5c071155bf
Closes-Bug: #1569669

commit_message:
Remove non-updatable attrs from SFC update test

ingress, egress and service_function_parameters were part of the
test_resource_handle_update(), testing the update of a networking-sfc
Port Pair. However, these attributes are not updatable from the
API definition and so are being removed from this test.

Change-Id: I88b197255eeae86331a9e52e872e6828ad93d6f6

For py35, message attribute in exception seems removed.
We should directly get the string message from exception object
if message attribute not presented. And since get message attribute
already been deprecated. We should remove sopport on
exception.message after we fully jump to py35.

Change-Id: I3970aa7c161aa82d179779f1a2f46405d5b0dddb
(cherry picked from commit 4ba0b5fe7f31d4353e9c091b03df7324d1c20e88)

commit_message:
Fix no message attribute in exception

For py35, message attribute in exception seems removed.
We should directly get the string message from exception object
if message attribute not presented. And since get message attribute
already been deprecated. We should remove sopport on
exception.message after we fully jump to py35.
Partial-Bug: #1704725

Change-Id: I3970aa7c161aa82d179779f1a2f46405d5b0dddb
(cherry picked from commit 4ba0b5fe7f31d4353e9c091b03df7324d1c20e88)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-11 15:09:08.000000000', 'message': 'Disable status handling in VPN service table

VPN service status remains in Pending Create after created
and it continues until an IPsec site connection is created
using the VPN service.
This leads to a sitaution that VPN serivce progress bar continues
to be shown forever after creating an IPsec site connection.
It is annoying and confusing because a user expects the progress
bar will disappear soon.

It looks better to disable the status handling in the VPN service
table as a workaround.

Ideally the status transition in VPN service should be revisit.

Closes-Bug: #1731635
Change-Id: Id0aee5b585c9922e3b337a5a619e45f54ba4030e
'}]
commit_message:
Disable status handling in VPN service table

VPN service status remains in Pending Create after created
and it continues until an IPsec site connection is created
using the VPN service.
This leads to a sitaution that VPN serivce progress bar continues
to be shown forever after creating an IPsec site connection.
It is annoying and confusing because a user expects the progress
bar will disappear soon.

It looks better to disable the status handling in the VPN service
table as a workaround.

Ideally the status transition in VPN service should be revisit.

Closes-Bug: #1731635
Change-Id: Id0aee5b585c9922e3b337a5a619e45f54ba4030e

commit_message:
Use TextInput widget for readonly choice fields

Read-only choice widget is difficult to be recognized.
This commit uses TextInput widget for such choice fields
which shows a current value.

Change-Id: I3b15a26bb089c8ecc547e0d51bc079d2adf975ba

subject: Use ThemableChoiceField
messages:
[{'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-11-11 14:19:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15905, 'date': '2017-11-13 03:21:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Could you please add more description to commit message about this change (benefit of new field if compare with current one)?'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-11-13 08:20:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

All of Horizon forms are themable. This means operators can customize styles of forms only by customizing CSS (or theme which is a set of CSS). The recommended way is to use ThemableChoiceField and this patch just tries to follow it. ChoiceField is not themable and there is no choice of page style as operators without modifying the code.

The corresponding blueprint is https://blueprints.launchpad.net/horizon/+spec/horizon-theme-css-reorg and it was implemented a while ago.

Do you want to have this in the commit message?'}, {'account_id': 15905, 'date': '2017-11-13 09:00:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

>All of Horizon forms are themable.
>
When looked at Horizon, I see there are not all forms are themable [1]. That was lead to my previous comment. But it is fine now.

P/s: Horizon may want to fixe for remaining choicefield also :-)

[1] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/networks/ports/workflows.py#L58
https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/routers/forms.py#L45-L46
https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/dashboards/settings/user/forms.py#L34-L35'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-11-13 09:19:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> [1] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/networks/ports/workflows.py#L58
> https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/routers/forms.py#L45-L46

The above two need to be converted into ThemableChoiceField. I think this is just uncovered during reviews.

> https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/dashboards/settings/user/forms.py#L34-L35

This is actually intended. In the current ThemableChoiceField, there is no way to focus on an item which is chosen now when opening a choice menu. The language and timezone lists are long and keeping the default selection is important. I thought I added a comment to the bug report but it seems I didn't."}, {'account_id': 15905, 'date': '2017-11-17 01:19:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow+1

Let me merge this as I don't see any comment/objection from other reviewers."}]

Closes-Bug: #1731624

'}]

commit_message:
removed horizon from test_requestent.txt

Horizon in the test_requestent.text causes failure
when installing devstack.
For the problem of depending on horizon,
we can move horizon.tar.gz to tox.ini
Change-Id: Ifcc109d1a8cc6df9baced39b76159e04505db3b1

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I90a75d5753c0edf4619488b502c2f3508e8f05f3

subject: Fix afs_slug for centos-7
messages: [{'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2017-11-17 00:34:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-11-17 00:35:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2017-11-17 00:36:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-17 00:34:58.000000000', 'message': "Fix afs_slug for centos-7

Because, why can't things be the same across distros?  We need
ansible_distribution_major_version for centos (7) and
ansible_distribution_version for ubuntu (16.04).

Change-Id: I06f3b587a78165674d0d09432164d79caa5ecf02
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix afs_slug for centos-7

Because, why can't things be the same across distros?  We need
ansible_distribution_major_version for centos (7) and
ansible_distribution_version for ubuntu (16.04).

Change-Id: I06f3b587a78165674d0d09432164d79caa5ecf02
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

This role uses msgmerge, which is provided by the gettext package in

commit_message:
Install gettext for msgmerge

This role uses msgmerge, which is provided by the gettext package in
most major distros.  Since it's a common name, I think we can get away
with just the generic package installer.

Change-Id: I16439329376172bbb896cb99d26d48383f2a3b60

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: Icb7de5c9020c3543c218744c0dc75e758f0abb43

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html

commit_message:
Add support for CephMgr in the ceph-ansible workflow

The upgrade of Ceph to Luminous requires a new daemon, ceph-mgr,
to be deployed with every ceph-mon. This submission adds support
for the deployment of ceph-mgr via ceph-ansible.

Change-Id: I3645c6c3f68fcefc93fa8699796ba8892aa946c8
Partially-Implements: blueprint ceph-luminous

commit_message:
Update ceph nagios plugin

Changes ceph plugin so it ignores ceph rebalancing unless there is a
large percentage of misplaced/degraded objects (return warning for
that).

Adds config options to tweak that monitoring, and also just warn if
nodeep-scrub was deliberately set.

Includes some basic unit tests.

Change-Id: I317448cd769597068a706d3944d9d5419e0445c1

commit_message:
Replace deprecated nova_metadata_ip

Option nova_metadata_ip was deprecated in favor
of nova_metadata_host.  lib/neutron was updated
recently but lib/neutron-legacy was missed.

Change-Id: Iadd42458dda705ad0c24aa4ab2afd5b27dd8f0e1

Looks good to me, no need to restore image in this case.'}, {'account_id': 20182, 'date': '2017-11-14 10:40:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-11-14 16:42:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Was going to ask if we needed to move the restore to before the raise, but I see Abhishek already addressed that in his comment.'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2017-11-16 01:31:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-11-16 22:15:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Removing the _restore() call completely as you do looks like the correct move here.  If it's moved to before the exception is raised, it will put the image into 'queued' which will block an import call on the image, even though there's apparently already data in the stage for that image."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-14 06:08:57.000000000', 'message': "Removing unreachable line from stage() method

In stage() method of v2 api, _restore() is called after raising
Duplicate exception, which won't be reachable in any case after
the exception is raised.

_restore() changes the image_status from 'uploading' to 'queued'
and  data staging would start from the beginning after new stage call
with same image-id even though staging data has already been loaded
to store.

Hence it seems there is no point in keeping that _restore() incase of
Duplicate exception is raised.

Change-Id: I317587bc1ba6544b722a11ae217a5d1212c96ce2
Closes-Bug: 1732077
"}, {'created': '2017-11-14 06:15:35.000000000', 'message': "Removing unreachable line from stage() method

In stage() method of v2 api, _restore() is called after raising
HTTPConflict exception, which won't be reachable in any case after
the exception is raised.

_restore() changes the image_status from 'uploading' to 'queued'
and  data staging would start from the beginning after new stage call
with same image-id even though staging data has already been loaded
to store.

Hence it seems there is no point in keeping that _restore() incase of
Duplicate exception is raised.

Change-Id: I317587bc1ba6544b722a11ae217a5d1212c96ce2
Closes-Bug: 1732077
"}]
commit_message:
Removing unreachable line from stage() method

In stage() method of v2 api, _restore() is called after raising
HTTPConflict exception, which won't be reachable in any case after
the exception is raised.

_restore() changes the image_status from 'uploading' to 'queued'
and  data staging would start from the beginning after new stage call
with same image-id even though staging data has already been loaded
to store.

Hence it seems there is no point in keeping that _restore() incase of
Duplicate exception is raised.

Change-Id: I317587bc1ba6544b722a11ae217a5d1212c96ce2
Closes-Bug: 1732077

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 21:06:26.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: If4de537abf60412c55b8a6d8ca4aee0fcd7f51fa
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: If4de537abf60412c55b8a6d8ca4aee0fcd7f51fa

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: Id7d6c1b8463feed6cc984ce666f576800dbeeb25

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: Ie5e8fe9a6d45753469666b4e086fe74502403f29

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-17 21:52:59.000000000', 'message': 'Add workflow for deployment via config-download

Adds a new workflow, tripleo.deployment.v1.deploy_plan_config_download,
that does a full overcloud deployment using the config download
mechanism.

This operates a little differently from the existing deployment
workflow, deploy_plan. That workflow returns as soon as the request to
create|update the Heat stack is accepted. The client is then subscribed
to a websocket queue to get events from the Heat stack.

In order to maintain API compatibility with deploy_plan, the new
workflow must wait for the Heat stack to finish creating, so that it can
then run the config download steps to finish the actual software
configuration of the overcloud. Further work is still needed to publish
those Heat stack events to the client queue.

Alternatively, the new workflow could be split into separate workflows
that match the behavior of deploy_plan, however that would eventually
require changes to other clients (UI, etc), as they would have to be
updated to call multiple workflows instead of just the single
deploy_plan.

implements: blueprint ansible-config-download
Change-Id: I738c78b32590c58ae8b721289ad8103ee09e9956
'}, {'created': '2017-10-18 16:03:31.000000000', 'message': 'Add workflow for deployment via config-download

In order to maintain API compatibility with deploy_plan, the new
workflow must wait for the Heat stack to finish creating, so that it can

those Heat stack events to the client queue.

Alternatively, the new workflow could be split into separate workflows

commit_message:
Add workflow for deployment via config-download

Adds a new workflow, tripleo.deployment.v1.config_download_deploy,
that does an overcloud configuration using the config download
mechanism.

This workflow can be called after deploy_plan when using the config
download mechanism. The corresponding client patch that depends on this
new workflow is If3114a6fda75ee502d80e4ba27b5f2e81ba44085.

Also adds the ansible-generate-inventory action which is used by the new
workflow.

implements: blueprint ansible-config-download
Change-Id: I738c78b32590c58ae8b721289ad8103ee09e9956

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2017-11-02 11:47:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Published edit on patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2017-11-02 11:48:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

so the change what is supposed to ... but I am not sure anymore if this is a good idea because it basically stops the deployment with a hard error during step 2 and to understand why, operators need to look at the execution output in mistral

what do you guys think? is this harming more than anything else?'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2017-11-02 12:05:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> so the change what is supposed to ... but I am not sure anymore if
 > this is a good idea because it basically stops the deployment with
 > a hard error during step 2 and to understand why, operators need to
 > look at the execution output in mistral
 > 
 > what do you guys think? is this harming more than anything else?

Well, based on what you stated in the lp [1] it seems we _do_ need to
forcefully stop the deployment, or else we risk corrupting an existing
OSD.

As for whether the user experience is ideal, I think this should be
treated as a separate problem. I agree the user shouldn't have to wade
into mistral executions to find out what really went wrong, but I think
that's a problem for the basic deployment framework to solve. That is,
how do we bubble ansible failures up so they are properly presented to
the user.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1723085"}, {'account_id': 19564, 'date': '2017-11-02 12:11:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Will it be harmful to do an ansible deployment of ceph and have legacy ceph setting in hiera? CephMon, CephOSD and so on all point to the ceph-ansible work flows. The puppet-ceph code should not be called. If there are other OSP heat or puppet code doing hiera calls into ceph:: values, then they should have been broken when we started the new workflow execution. A real problem will come if CephMon is pointing to the ansible workflow and CephOSD (or others) pointing to puppet.'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2017-11-02 12:14:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

hi thanks for the input, maybe we can stop only on those parameters which are worrisome (::osds)?'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2017-11-02 12:19:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> hi thanks for the input, maybe we can stop only on those parameters
 > which are worrisome (::osds)?

That sounds like a good approach. Don't stop the deployment unless it's necessary to prevent doing harm.

Not sure if it's worth the effort, but maybe generate a warning if other non-critical hieradata is found? But maybe the warning will never be seen if it's buried deep in a mistral execution output. I guess I don't have a firm view on this."}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2017-11-02 13:14:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Published edit on patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2017-11-02 13:15:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Marios, Lukas, this is something we might see on upgrade to OSP12'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2017-11-02 15:30:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2017-11-02 16:18:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

I still like this patch as is. 

If I were an operator I'd rather have my update fail, such that I can fix something and then configure it to succeed, than have it sneak in something that may cause bigger problems down the road. Better to bring it to user's attention. All that said I'd rather have my update fail with a helpful message than have to go through the mistral logs, but that's a different issue. I think the user will find out the problem."}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2017-11-07 09:59:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Dougal, this guy was supposed to proceed (and not fail) when $.hieradata is [] but it seems to be blocking (fail) the deployment anyway [1]; have any clue why?

1. http://logs.openstack.org/74/511474/7/check/legacy-tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario001-multinode-oooq-container/1906a35/logs/undercloud/var/log/mistral/engine.log.txt.gz#_2017-11-02_14_41_13_384'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2017-11-07 10:00:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2017-11-07 18:13:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: -Code-Review

> Dougal, this guy was supposed to proceed (and not fail) when
 > $.hieradata is [] but it seems to be blocking (fail) the deployment
 > anyway [1]; have any clue why?
 
Giulio, I also don't know why this failed, but you might try using YAQL's bool() function. Here's a snippet from the documentation [1]. Note that it specifically mentions how it handles empty lists.

"bool

    Returns true or false after value type conversion to boolean. Function returns false if value is 0, false, empty list, empty dictionary, empty string, empty set, and timespan(). All other values are considered to be true."

[1] https://yaql.readthedocs.io/en/latest/standard_library.html#comparison-operators'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2017-11-08 00:44:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

commit_message:
Fail ceph-ansible workflow if there is stale puppet-ceph hieradata

We should stop the deployment if there is stale puppet-ceph
hieradata because it isn't converted automatically into
ceph-ansible variables.

Initially we only stop the deployment if ceph::profile::params::osds
is found to make sure operators have converted that into a ceph-ansible
parameter and removed it from the Heat environment file.

Change-Id: I6031625b128b989c78f20350d2971cc61bf874b1
Closes-Bug: #1723085

[{'created': '2017-11-07 17:51:00.000000000', 'message': 'include sub-resources in base api get_extended_resources

Today the get_extended_resources method of our APIExtensionDescriptor
class does not account for the SUB_RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP and as a
result callers of update_attributes_map will also not see the sub
resources.

This patch updates get_extended_resources to include the sub resources
as well.

Note that today in neutron, we have both uses:
- neutron.extensions.qos.Qos.get_extended_resources uses sub resources.
- neutron.extensions.flavors.Flavors.get_extended_resources does not
use the sub resource map.

Change-Id: I8ae11633962a48de6e8559b85447b8c8c753d705
'}, {'created': '2017-11-07 19:48:29.000000000', 'message': 'class methods and sub resources in base api ext

class does not account for the SUB_RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP and as a

as well.

- neutron.extensions.qos.Qos.get_extended_resources uses sub resources.
- neutron.extensions.flavors.Flavors.get_extended_resources does not
use the sub resource map.

In addition this patch changes the methods defined in the

need a way to access the update_attributes_map method without having

commit_message:
class methods and sub resources in base api ext

Today the get_extended_resources method of our APIExtensionDescriptor
class does not account for the SUB_RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP and as a
result callers of update_attributes_map will also not see the sub
resources.

This patch updates get_extended_resources to include the sub resources
as well.

Note that today in neutron, we have both uses:
- neutron.extensions.qos.Qos.get_extended_resources uses sub resources.
- neutron.extensions.flavors.Flavors.get_extended_resources does not
use the sub resource map.

In addition this patch changes the methods defined in the
APIExtensionDescriptor to be class methods rather than instance methods.
There is no real instance data to maintain and in addition consumers
need a way to access the update_attributes_map method without having
to import and create a concrete neutron extension instance [1].

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=%5C(%5C)%5C.update_attributes_map%5C(

Change-Id: I8ae11633962a48de6e8559b85447b8c8c753d705
