I want to review this and the links before merge.
I agree that it's silly to install to render these, but I dis-agree that release notes are version independent. Release notes have an upgrade section that is specific to the release of notes detailing upgrade related issues.  I need to understand if that distinction will be lost with this change."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-11-16 20:13:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Michael, this removes the version number in the left of the document only - the navigation bar. There it currently says for Neutron "Neutron Release Notes 12.0.0." and we change this to "Neutron Release Notes".

Compare https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/nova/ and http://logs.openstack.org/73/520373/3/check/build-openstack-releasenotes/bdce451/html/'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-11-16 20:14:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 19:36:31.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: If08a21e653e74f7d6fbaf520b8f0e1d2d607b501
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: If08a21e653e74f7d6fbaf520b8f0e1d2d607b501

commit_message:
Switch to gzip for build-wheel-mirror job

This avoids the need to install bzip2 / bzip2-libs for centos.

Change-Id: Ia76730b6394564c14913678241eef373aebadf2b
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Bump Ansible to 2.3

The change I57168f15d63f638bd0217955a3a3c245a986c541 has conditional
logic for ansible versions before 2.3, so this change is now just a
requirements increment.

Change-Id: Id2711d4ff6f980e98f6f4bf5c2d3838ad9ca288f

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 12:28:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix on PeriodicTask locking mechanism

One patch [1] introduced a bug on the locking mechanism. Since there
were no unit tests that covered it and there were no tests to catch
this. This patch adds the corresponding test and fixes the bug.

[1]: I31085cf73618df48f55f3169e071d2cb64c9b018

Change-Id: I4288274bced051236e163f5786b91fe408f8453d

commit_message:
Fix on PeriodicTask locking mechanism

One patch [1] introduced a bug on the locking mechanism. Since there
were no unit tests that covered it and there were no tests to catch
this. This patch adds the corresponding test and fixes the bug.

[1]: I31085cf73618df48f55f3169e071d2cb64c9b018

Change-Id: I4288274bced051236e163f5786b91fe408f8453d
Closes-Bug: 1731893
(cherry picked from commit 30e11bd2e603290ade010e8842d3da18d64c4ffe)

messages:
[{'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2017-11-08 14:17:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2017-11-08 18:33:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Te change set you pointed is only in Oxygen master branch, right?
so What if we use nitrogen or carbon?

The patch you pointed out is to set default variable. So what if user wants to set the value explicitly via devstack?
From change of odlparent, to me it means that those three environment variables don't have to be exported explicity because they value default value. but if developer wants to set them, they should be configurable via devstack. So jit doesn't make sense to just remove it. So those env variables should be conditionally exported only when developer sets it.

What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 27251, 'date': '2017-11-08 20:47:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> What do you think?

Hello Isaku! how are you? So this is my very very first comment on an openstack Gerrit (after a few hundred [thousand?] over on opendaylight) ... do you openstack guys send out t-shirts or something for first comments? ;-)

More importantly: I'm guessing you're probably right that ODL Xmx should be configurable via devstack IFF so desired, for folks who know what they are doing. (I don't know anything about these devstack scripts, so cannot comment on the way to do this best here; can you help?)

But the main problem this must adress (you'll best know how; I dunno) is that if someone using devstack does nothing, then devstack shall not by itself give ODL its own default low 512 MB Xmx - that default should just be "whatever ODL has in its start up scripts" (unrelated to whether that's Oxygen or Nitrogen or Carbon; or if for that matter we ever decide to increase or decrease it in ODL).

FYI this came out of https://jira.opendaylight.org/browse/GENIUS-96.'}, {'account_id': 11240, 'date': '2017-11-08 21:19:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

 > 
 > But the main problem this must adress (you'll best know how; I
 > dunno) is that if someone using devstack does nothing, then
 > devstack shall not by itself give ODL its own default low 512 MB
 > Xmx - that default should just be "whatever ODL has in its start up
 > scripts" (unrelated to whether that's Oxygen or Nitrogen or Carbon;
 > or if for that matter we ever decide to increase or decrease it in
 > ODL).
 > 
 > FYI this came out of https://jira.opendaylight.org/browse/GENIUS-96.

Agreed on most comments. We need to keep config settings in the local.conf, but the defaults should be what ODL has for defaults. Or almost anything above 512, which I think is a very outdated value.'}, {'account_id': 11240, 'date': '2017-11-08 21:29:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Remove JVM memory limitations by default

ODL already takes care of setting these values[1], so there is no
need of setting them at devstack unless otherwise desired. This patch
makes optional to set the limitations, and they will only be set
if they are specifically included.

[1] https://github.com/opendaylight/odlparent/blob/master/karaf/opendaylight-karaf-resources/src/main/patches/karaf-setenv-4.1.3.patch

Change-Id: I929224d8ab1410857f9a85dc64143eb75cc28a81

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release values.
We've found that most projects now require the service package to be
installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely due to
the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

Change-Id: I17f397302374fb86e10cfd8010428621873dbab5
Needed-by: I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: Ieb0be952943e102678657758875a5d13fb4d28e4

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: Ib05158e7e02eca588941c0a710a8f9dd433934ca

What if we automatically try to install the current project, but ignore a failure to do so? commit_message:
Build releasenotes without tox

Build releasenotes without tox and use a venv directly. This avoids
problems with special tox install commands in certain projects.

For now, install current project as well to avoid breaking projects that
set version or release for releasenotes document.

This follows the CTI:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html#release-notes

Change-Id: I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: Iff42251b86644698081296d01b1b21d9ebfb22a5

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html

commit_message:
Change cred provider to enforce dynamic config

Current tests always dynamically create accounts when running.

These tests do not run when, for example, LDAP is configured.

This change allows murano_tempest_tests to correctly interpret
use_dynamic_credentials config in the [auth] section of tempest.conf

When use_dynamic_credentials is set to True, dynamic accounts will be created.
When set to false, pre-provisioned accounts specified in
accounts.yaml Tempest config will be used.

And Remove download murano images from app.openstack.org

Closes-Bug: #1677893
Change-Id: I51434685555c1da92401891a60285bf52571b8b5
(cherry picked from commit 8a3ed3f833ebc6d3a982dbe6e8d22158b00fa044)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-18 20:20:45.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor set bios settings code

This patch refactors the code that deals with setting BIOS settings to use
code in common with setting iDRAC card settings.

Previously, set_bios_settings returned commit_required, which was actually
set to indicate if a reboot of the server was required.  The response to a
SetAttributes call to an iDRAC returns two different values, one that
indicates if a configuration job needs to be created, and another that
indicates if the server needs to be rebooted.  The new code returns
is_commit_required and is_reboot_required which are respectively set to these
values.  For backwards compatibility, the code continues to return
commit_required, but this parameter should be considered deprecated and it
will be removed in a future release.

Change-Id: Idf7284f2113b983358dfcdcd9acc5c73d4c9b927
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor set bios settings code

This patch refactors the code that deals with setting BIOS settings to use
code in common with setting iDRAC card settings.

Previously, set_bios_settings returned commit_required, which was actually
set to indicate if a reboot of the server was required.  The response to a
SetAttributes call to an iDRAC returns two different values, one that
indicates if a configuration job needs to be created, and another that
indicates if the server needs to be rebooted.  The new code returns
is_commit_required and is_reboot_required which are respectively set to these
values.  For backwards compatibility, the code continues to return
commit_required, but this parameter should be considered deprecated and it
will be removed in a future release.

Change-Id: Idf7284f2113b983358dfcdcd9acc5c73d4c9b927

commit_message:
Add rescue_interface to node DB table

Add rescue_interface DB field, database migration,
and object entry for node rescue functionality.

Change-Id: I2cd8c31283e57249fdf7d30e801052db050660ba
Partial-bug: #1526449
Co-Authored-By: Jay Faulkner <jay@jvf.cc>
Co-Authored-By: Josh Gachnang <josh@pcsforeducation.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jesse J. Cook <jesse.j.cook@member.fsf.org>
Co-Authored-By: Mario Villaplana <mario.villaplana@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Aparna <aparnavtce@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Shivanand Tendulker <stendulker@gmail.com>

'}, {'created': '2017-11-16 13:51:31.000000000', 'message': 'Change override-branch to override-checkout

commit_message:
Change override-branch to override-checkout

The tox-py35-on-zuul job was using override-branch to force
feature/zuulv3 which was not working and causing master to be
checked out.  Use override-checkout, which is the correct name now.

Change-Id: I8dfe5a41710392d6ca8453ce365f674a9d5e4f6e

commit_message:
[ci] Start migrating to zuul v3

This patch migrates 2 jobs install-ubuntu and install-centos. Both these
jobs have an equal playbook, so they are merged now and only job
definitions set the proper node type.

Also, the post playbook for most of rally jobs are added. It is generic
and can remove a bunch of code duplication.

Change-Id: Ifb7c11539fc505a85c6aa7f7e367b4f60d5797dd

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 19:33:50.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I63863a674c756802ece9934ab27b65bc95c698e1
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I63863a674c756802ece9934ab27b65bc95c698e1

commit_message:
Add pep8 job for designate-specs

Currently, Designate-specs just check sphinx without pep8, thus
they have a lot of pep8 error in specs (*.rst file).

Along with this PS, we will push new PS to validate all *.rst files
in designate-specs which will located in pep8 check.

Change-Id: Ia661dde27dc397e0fad566393ac575812e1808be

The patch itself seems okay, but I've pinged a colleague who is highly experienced in encryption/randomness in Python to weigh in on it. I just want to be sure we're approaching this the right way."}, {'account_id': 8004, 'date': '2017-11-16 14:26:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

(3 comments)

Replacing PyCrypto's random with os.urandom/SystemRandom is absolutely the right choice (os.urandom/SystemRandom is both better and also nobody should be using PyCrypto).

I did put a few extra comments that could be addressed in future CRs, but mostly I'd suggest significantly simplifying this code. There's no need for dynamic dispatch of methods based on string building. You can generate a password with 128-bits of entropy with binascii.hexlify(os.urandom(16)) and token gen/key gen are just pure random bytes with specific lengths."}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-11-16 15:05:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2

Thanks for taking a look at this, Paul.

I'm okay with this as-is as a small improvement, but we should get a bug open to make the improvements that Paul mentioned."}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-11-16 16:23:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Make pw-token-gen.py more random

This fix utilizes the urandom method in the os mmodule and provides
more randomness in our generation tool.

Closes-bug: 1732295
Change-Id: I060976d243dfc4ddc7fd67aff36f3a888a0a363e

commit_message:
Update charm to use Python 3

Updates across the charm and unit tests to switch to
execution under Python 3.

Note that the changes are not backwards compatible
with Python 2.

Refactor use of neutronclient python module to simply
wrap the neutron binary, using the yaml output format
to avoid the requirement for a Python 3 module on
older OpenStack release versions.

Change-Id: Ic26b0dd19a76552481939325963a6c21585dee3c

[{'created': '2017-11-15 02:30:02.000000000', 'message': "Add defusedxml to global requirements repo

The defusedxml package contains several Python-only workarounds
and fixes for denial of service and other vulnerabilities in
Python's XML libraries. We are fixing security related issues in
Cinder project and introducing this library [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/519618/

Is the library actively maintained?
Yes - https://pypi.org/project/defusedxml/#history

Is the library good code?
Yes, it is pretty straight forward code

Is the library python 3 compatible?
Yes

Is the library license compatible?
Yes - PSF

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?
No

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries?
Not that I am aware of

Is the library required for OpenStack project?
Yes, Cinder would like to use it in: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/519618

If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process?
N/A

Change-Id: I5e797bb757b36bbf0619b398d2cb5ca8364438a6
"}]
commit_message:
Add defusedxml to global requirements repo

The defusedxml package contains several Python-only workarounds
and fixes for denial of service and other vulnerabilities in
Python's XML libraries. We are fixing security related issues in
Cinder project and introducing this library [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/519618/

Is the library actively maintained?
Yes - https://pypi.org/project/defusedxml/#history

Is the library good code?
Yes, it is pretty straight forward code

Is the library python 3 compatible?
Yes

Is the library license compatible?
Yes - PSF

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?
No

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries?
Not that I am aware of

Is the library required for OpenStack project?
Yes, Cinder would like to use it in: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/519618

If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process?
N/A

Change-Id: I5e797bb757b36bbf0619b398d2cb5ca8364438a6

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I3ef4ddb106a92229607a577e3c8d03fcbe23d599
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I3ef4ddb106a92229607a577e3c8d03fcbe23d599

commit_message:
Set the 'Upgrade impact' subsection as optional

The 'Upgrade impact' subsection has been added in the spec template
in I1798f2bdb246af9b9b12dbe9276d0a68a82e4c88.

But 'py27' test fails since it is merged
because the 'Upgrade impact' subsection is required
in existing queens and backlog specs.

So set the 'Upgrade impact' subsection as optional
in queens and backlog specs.

Change-Id: I8c69369a421454f30675a9ad9da8b9c51a2e7baa
Closes-Bug: #1727602

messages:
[{'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2017-11-16 03:44:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2017-11-16 03:48:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

See http://logs.openstack.org/23/517223/2/check/openstack-tox-py27/9de4411/job-output.txt.gz'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-11-16 04:12:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hmm, so why doesn't the py27 job run on this change? We need to get that fixed. It's probably something wrong with the zuulv3 transition."}, {'account_id': 25254, 'date': '2017-11-16 06:44:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We should replace by linters instead of py27. I also pushed this change in following PS https://review.openstack.org/#/c/519561. Then we need add linters to gate.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-11-16 15:53:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Matt: it's because most projects want to skip unit tests when only documentation is altered, and nova-specs is a bit odd in having Python "unit tests" to validate RST formatting. Generally, as Nguyen points out, this should be done with a linter of some sort rather than a unit testing framework.'}, {'account_id': 25254, 'date': '2017-11-16 16:10:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Jeremy: I has pushed linter job into project-config, but they require push validation inside pep8. Thus we could not use linter job. Please advice? And py27 job should remove on the gate?'}, {'account_id': 25254, 'date': '2017-11-16 16:15:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

project-config PS: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/520329/'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-11-16 16:53:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

pep8 is a linter, and most projects simply dump all their linter-like static analysis checks into that same "pep8" tox environment because they all tend to be fast and lightweight so there's little point in splitting them into separate jobs. Just add the commands you want run into the testenv:pep8 section of tox.ini and you should hopefully be fine.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-11-16 18:57:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Fix "Line limited to a maximum of 79 characters"

The py27 job was not executed
when Id7ed89a24ff6e2fd7ab4eee5b117cb6b6c763c44 was merged.

So fix the maximum length of the line.

Closes-Bug: #1732581

Collect logs from build-wheel-mirror jobs

We generate build logs when we build wheels, collect them so we can
review if there is an issue.

commit_message:
Filter users/groups in ldap with whitespaces

All users and groups are required to have a name. With this fix,
Keystone will ignore users and groups that do have only white
spaces as value for the LDAP attribute which Keystone has been
configured to use for that entity's name.

Change-Id: Id539e1b7e1cea8b05cd9bb753707e1fc98244d29
Closes-Bug: #1727726
(cherry picked from commit 789573a0f17fd3ea8abd1a89034b865035925a8f)

commit_message:
Add option for ceph ansible playbook

We need to provide an option to let the user
change the default ansible playbook path
for ceph-ansible update.

Closes-Bug: #1723428

[{'created': '2017-11-15 09:16:25.000000000', 'message': "Fail on upgrade if legacy ceph::profile::params::osds hiera is found

We should stop the deployment if there is certain stale puppet-ceph
hieradata because if it isn't converted into ceph-ansible variables
the latter could break the deployment using wrong defaults.

Change-Id: Ice2e79a4a3b9a2427b706ec888d6bb8bcca2c542

commit_message:
Fail on upgrade if legacy ceph::profile::params::osds hiera is found

We should stop the deployment if there is certain stale puppet-ceph
hieradata because if it isn't converted into ceph-ansible variables
the latter could break the deployment using wrong defaults.

Change-Id: Ice2e79a4a3b9a2427b706ec888d6bb8bcca2c542
Related-Bug: #1723085
(cherry picked from commit ee10ae9f6ee5a1b74ea52c1bb69c06083caa31de)

subject: Remove SecretsHelper
messages: [{'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-11-16 17:47:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2017-11-16 18:07:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2017-11-16 18:22:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\nAlways like such patches:)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 17:47:56.000000000', 'message': "Remove SecretsHelper

This code hasn't worked for over two years when
9ed9ab68f7d2fb98c505afc3a1079a72f15c959c was added
which does API version discovery, which requires auth,
which happens before the SecretsHelper is used. That was
back in the 2.27.0 release in the Liberty series.

Given how long this has been broken without anyone noticing,
and it's undocumented and untested (basically), and
python-openstackclient properly handles prompting for a password,
we should just remove this code rather than try to fix it.

Change-Id: I62188e73a48f6878ce920a3b4724dba101564aef
Closes-Bug: #1732744
"}]
commit_message:
Remove SecretsHelper

This code hasn't worked for over two years when
9ed9ab68f7d2fb98c505afc3a1079a72f15c959c was added
which does API version discovery, which requires auth,
which happens before the SecretsHelper is used. That was
back in the 2.27.0 release in the Liberty series.

Given how long this has been broken without anyone noticing,
and it's undocumented and untested (basically), and
python-openstackclient properly handles prompting for a password,
we should just remove this code rather than try to fix it.

Change-Id: I62188e73a48f6878ce920a3b4724dba101564aef
Closes-Bug: #1732744

commit_message:
Protect rootwrap daemon socket against multiple threads

Wrap the call with eventlet.Semaphore. Simultaneous Client.execute
calls can fail badly. Alternatively, rootwrap daemon connections
could be made every time when Client.execute is called, without
using a semaphore.

Change-Id: Id9d38832c67f2d81d382cda797a48fee943a27f1
Closes-bug: #1654287

commit_message:
Add requirements-check job

This is a straight copy of the original gate-{name}-requirements job,
except it copies the script over to the host rather than depending on a
baked-in copy of the script. Followups should rework it to stop using
zuul-cloner.

(jlk) updated to fix pep8 errors so that the patch can land.

Change-Id: I734db3b3e4d445e15084d1ca6e60cf2fe392385d
(cherry picked from commit 5e0f7cba3f23274734f894a57ac8fab078663778)

commit_message:
zuul: clean up job definition

This cleans up the zuul job definition:
- moves the 'irrelevant-files' list from project.yaml to
  legacy-sushy-jobs.yaml so that it isn't duplicated
- adds more irrelevant files to the list
- removes requirements.txt from the list of irrelevant files, since
  we want the job to run if this file changes
- reorders the job definition so that the irrelevant-files and
  required-projects are first. This makes it more consistent
  with the other ironic-related projects

Change-Id: Ifea6a3d220943a5a454a803b0633664a91af5c49

messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-11-16 17:48:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-11-16 17:50:32.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to releasenotes-version'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-11-16 17:51:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 17:48:48.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I8160e7ab5358868e039b22d65daf19b780fb991a
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I8160e7ab5358868e039b22d65daf19b780fb991a

commit_message:
Add volume_image_metadata info to volume GET response

volume_image_metadata is not listed as a possible response value in
the api ref for volume details. This adds it to the parameter list
as an optionally returned object.

Change-Id: I3992942e7ec6464d9463d8570cde8e848e89733c

commit_message:
Stop posting to os-volumes_boot

os-volumes_boot is an old clone of /servers and is not documented in the
API docs. POST to /servers.

Change-Id: If0161a89877f19f24e91d780cf227fdc48e7e860

commit_message:
Update to new connector constants

Code still referred to the old deprecated connector constants that
have now been removed in os-brick. This updates the code to use
the newer, correct constants.

Change-Id: I7a21792c10abe6a71808a4846494987dfd9f1c4b

commit_message:
Add details about boot baremetal from cinder volume

Also add a router to the provisioning network so that
the metadata service works (config drive isn't available in
ironic bfv).

Change-Id: I9eb4bfdbf03f605c28fab2f5263fc1f1159b50d4

Minor nit and a question, won't hold out the patch on this."}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2017-10-24 03:57:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2017-10-24 03:59:23.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bug/1647411 to bp/sahara-force-delete'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2017-10-24 12:49:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22689, 'date': '2017-10-27 01:43:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2017-11-14 16:44:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

In addition to this forced case when some resources are left behind, allowing the cluster to be deleted, I think that another case should be handled by this new API endpoint. I observed from time to time (but difficult to reproduce) that the stack was deleted (i.e. no more in the list), but sahara still had the cluster in deleting state. Is it something  that can be considered here as well?

(less important) about the resources left behind: would it possible for the user to retrieve their list through this API?'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2017-11-14 17:03:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

The task outlined in the spec that I am calling "remove the last bit of direct engine" code refers to the call to `_shutdown_instances` here: https://github.com/openstack/sahara/blob/98d2a7067f7e53985a08e4b6643c06e69f7743c2/sahara/service/heat/heat_engine.py#L193

Right now, basically if Heat stack is non existent then Sahara is trying manual cleanup. For abandonment to work we have to remove that call to `_shutdown_instances` anyway. 

So, after this spec is implemented you will no longer see the case of a deleted stack but a Sahara cluster still stuck in deletING sate.




Regarding your other suggestion, it might be possible but perhaps not feasible to do in a pretty way. I think Heat stack abandon returns a response body which is compatible with Heat stack adopt, but I don't think it returns specific IDs of resources. It's probably not worth the hassle, but we could consider finding out and returning the IDs of some of the obvious stuff like auto sec group and instances, etc.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2017-11-15 13:34:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Thanks for the explanation; would it make sense to mention this nice side effect briefly in the spec?'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2017-11-15 18:01:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2017-11-15 18:03:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2017-11-15 18:11:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2017-11-15 18:22:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2017-11-16 17:56:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Spec for force deletion of clusters

This specification details how Heat's stack abandon feature will be
leveraged to accomplish the force deletion of clusters.

APIImpact

Partially-Implements: bp sahara-force-delete
Related-Bug: #1647411

Change-Id: Iaf992fd6c89d46668e88bec536002bfffb1854dc

Enable cell service

This PS adds nova_cell0 database and init cell service.

Implements: blueprint enable-cell-service

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-14 15:49:13.000000000', 'message': "Validate new image via scheduler during rebuild

During a rebuild we bypass the scheduler because we are
always rebuilding the instance on the same host it's already
on. However, we allow passing a new image during rebuild
and that new image needs to be validated to work with the
instance host by running it through the scheduler filters,
like the ImagePropertiesFilter. Otherwise the new image
could violate constraints placed on the host by the admin.

This change checks to see if there is a new image provided
and if so, modifies the request spec passed to the scheduler
so that the new image is validated all while restricting
the scheduler to still pick the same host that the instance
is running on. If the image is not valid for the host, the
scheduler will raise NoValidHost and the rebuild stops.

A functional test is added to show the recreate of the bug
and that we probably stop the rebuild now in conductor by
calling the scheduler to validate the image.

Co-Authored-By: Sylvain Bauza <sbauza@redhat.com>

Closes-Bug: #1664931

NOTE(mriedem): There were a few changes needed for Newton:

1. There is no PlacementFixture but it's not needed.
2. The API client needs to have the microversion set from
   the test.
3. The enabled_filters config option wasn't in Newton.
4. The scheduler has to be started before compute otherwise
   we get a MessagingTimeout due to the CastAsCall fixture
   during the compute startup.

Change-Id: I11746d1ea996a0f18b7c54b4c9c21df58cc4714b
(cherry picked from commit 984dd8ad6add4523d93c7ce5a666a32233e02e34)
(cherry picked from commit 9e2d63da94db63d97bd02e373bfc53d95808b833)
(cherry picked from commit b72105c1c49fcddc94992af63fc2f8078023491a)

commit_message:
Validate new image via scheduler during rebuild

During a rebuild we bypass the scheduler because we are
always rebuilding the instance on the same host it's already
on. However, we allow passing a new image during rebuild
and that new image needs to be validated to work with the
instance host by running it through the scheduler filters,
like the ImagePropertiesFilter. Otherwise the new image
could violate constraints placed on the host by the admin.

This change checks to see if there is a new image provided
and if so, modifies the request spec passed to the scheduler
so that the new image is validated all while restricting
the scheduler to still pick the same host that the instance
is running on. If the image is not valid for the host, the
scheduler will raise NoValidHost and the rebuild stops.

A functional test is added to show the recreate of the bug
and that we probably stop the rebuild now in conductor by
calling the scheduler to validate the image.

Co-Authored-By: Sylvain Bauza <sbauza@redhat.com>

Closes-Bug: #1664931

NOTE(mriedem): There were a few changes needed for Newton:

1. There is no PlacementFixture but it's not needed.
2. The API client needs to have the microversion set from
   the test.
3. The enabled_filters config option wasn't in Newton.
4. The scheduler has to be started before compute otherwise
   we get a MessagingTimeout due to the CastAsCall fixture
   during the compute startup.

Depends-On: I344d8fdded9b7d5385fcb41b699f1352acb4cda7

Change-Id: I11746d1ea996a0f18b7c54b4c9c21df58cc4714b
(cherry picked from commit 984dd8ad6add4523d93c7ce5a666a32233e02e34)
(cherry picked from commit 9e2d63da94db63d97bd02e373bfc53d95808b833)
(cherry picked from commit b72105c1c49fcddc94992af63fc2f8078023491a)

thanks Mark!'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2017-11-15 16:13:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

Thanks for the patch! So the tear_down code is only invoked if there is an API request to delete the node.

Wouldn't we also want to do this when we detect an error, eg at [1]. Or maybe it is OK if it is in the provisioning network even if the deploy fails that early in the process? Is it just when nova is involved, that we have to worry about this because of the disconnect/order-of-things-with-nova-and-ironic? (I am wondering about the stand alone/bifrost case).

[1] https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/6525a0da29b937f26ae855175265f539bfbee591/ironic/conductor/manager.py#L2821"}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2017-11-15 16:14:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2017-11-15 16:58:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for the review Ruby.

 > (2 comments)
 > 
 > Thanks for the patch! So the tear_down code is only invoked if
 > there is an API request to delete the node.

You mean delete the instance, right?

 > 
 > Wouldn't we also want to do this when we detect an error, eg at
 > [1]. Or maybe it is OK if it is in the provisioning network even if
 > the deploy fails that early in the process? Is it just when nova is
 > involved, that we have to worry about this because of the
 > disconnect/order-of-things-with-nova-and-ironic? (I am wondering
 > about the stand alone/bifrost case).
 > 
 > [1] https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/6525a0da29b937f26ae855175265f539bfbee591/ironic/conductor/manager.py#L2821


I think there's some sense in cleaning up the provisioning ports immediately after a failed deployment. That said, the code you linked to [1] doesn't really do any cleanup at that point, it just moves the node to deploy failed. Perhaps one reason for this is that by keeping all cleanup logic in the tear down API call, all cleanup must succeed to move the node to available. This is hard to guarantee in a failure handler.

Looking at the ironic state machine [2], we should always clean up the provisioning network ports with this change applied - either before moving to active, or when moving to cleaning during tear down. The fiddly bit is where the states can bounce around in the middle due to rebuilds. I think these are covered by [3], which removes old provisioning ports before creating new ones.

[2] https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/pike/_images/states.svg
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/348392/"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2017-11-15 17:02:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2017-11-15 17:32:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> So the tear_down code is only invoked if there
> is an API request to delete the node.
Sorry, I meant 'PUT /v1/nodes/<node>/states/provision deleted', which is deleting the instance.

I looked at our state diagram, and if a deploy fails, the choices are 'rebuild', 'active' and 'deleted', so I think this is a reasonable solution. Thanks."}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2017-11-15 17:34:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Remove provisioning network ports during tear down

Previously, provisioning network ports were only deleted during a
successful deployment, when the node's network is flipped from the
provisioning network to the tenant network. In many failure scenarios
this code path would not be reached, as well as the case of aborting
deployment. This is not normally an issue, because during instance
termination, nova deletes all ports with a device ID matching the
instance's UUID, including any remaining provisioning ports.

This change removes the provisioning network ports when tearing down a
node to ensure that they are deleted in all scenarios.

Change-Id: I5656802ee04b44247f4a81bb311b5e306a737a4e
Closes-Bug: #1732412
Related-Bug: #1607394

commit_message:
Fix node count formatting on deployment page

When there are no nodes, show a zero and not nothing.

Adjust the 'Nodes Total' number to be all nodes (ready or not), and not just the
number of available nodes.

Change-Id: I784bf1eec82d60a4e8060805358e3138ab67c8ba
(cherry picked from commit 99cbe059deb643c3a9e04e1ab7d96e106b2288f6)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-15 16:37:47.000000000', 'message': 'Fix extracting nova fault string on build error

There was an edge case where if we were not able to extract nova interface
information our code that extracts the nova fault information would be
bypassed. This patch moves the fault extraction to a point where it will
be able to capture the fault string even if it was network interface
related.

Change-Id: Ia46522524e80022cd528e4902585213b1de42a44
'}]
commit_message:
Fix extracting nova fault string on build error

There was an edge case where if we were not able to extract nova interface
information our code that extracts the nova fault information would be
bypassed. This patch moves the fault extraction to a point where it will
be able to capture the fault string even if it was network interface
related.

Change-Id: Ia46522524e80022cd528e4902585213b1de42a44

After Launchpad Bug #1694666 it's clear that we need to run tempest in
our promotion promotion job, in order to avoid these kind of problems
in future. The ping test doesn't cover everything, just a very small

Change-Id: I77bac7922cfe5973f6a1c75a98d8a120e7c1b095

commit_message:
Adding periodic tripleo tempest job in promotion

After Launchpad Bug #1694666 it's clear that we need to run tempest in
our promotion promotion job, in order to avoid these kind of problems
in future. The ping test doesn't cover everything, just a very small
part of what tripleo are capable to do.

Change-Id: I77bac7922cfe5973f6a1c75a98d8a120e7c1b095

commit_message:
Removing legacy-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-ha-tempest-oooq job

This job was running in the experimental queue only smoke tests.
A new job running full tempest will be implemented in rdo cloud
for the same purpose.

Change-Id: I76fa8af4e0a8c243ae76b40c56cd615e324688ba

commit_message:
Fix missing metavar in aggregate-update

Fix missing metavar in aggregate-update
in order to fix inconsistency with other options.

If 'metavar' is not added, 'NAME' is used instead of '<name>'.
But it should be '<name>'.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: I22c012bac3381f63a3bfb5a5d0c6f0260d174695

commit_message:
Replace assertGreaterEqual with assertNotEmpty

There are still  occurrence of using assertGreaterEqual
to check whether list is empty, this is to replace it
with assertNotEmpty for code clean.

Change-Id: I5ff837db5cfb1b92c806e20d796cea6dbecdbe21

commit_message:

commit_message:
Fix on PeriodicTask locking mechanism

One patch [1] introduced a bug on the locking mechanism. Since there
were no unit tests that covered it and there were no tests to catch
this. This patch adds the corresponding test and fixes the bug.

[1]: I31085cf73618df48f55f3169e071d2cb64c9b018

Change-Id: I4288274bced051236e163f5786b91fe408f8453d
Closes-Bug: 1731893

[{'created': '2016-12-27 19:23:21.000000000', 'message': 'Remove HTTP error code when creating flavor

While attempting to create an existing flavor, the error message
contains the HTTP status code, which is not required.

For example: nova flavor-create test 13 1024 1 1
ERROR (Conflict): Flavor with name f1 already exists. (HTTP 409) ...

Just the error description is enough to let the user know what
happened.

Removed the error code from the exception message and changed it to
exceptions.CommandError type because the exception must be old-style
classes or derived from BaseException.

Change-Id: I5b4dba6e53e6b6fef1a3fec469d370a6e010f232
Closes-Bug: #1533083
'}]
commit_message:
Remove HTTP error code when creating flavor

While attempting to create an existing flavor, the error message
contains the HTTP status code, which is not required.

For example: nova flavor-create test 13 1024 1 1
ERROR (Conflict): Flavor with name f1 already exists. (HTTP 409) ...

Just the error description is enough to let the user know what
happened.

Removed the error code from the exception message and changed it to
exceptions.CommandError type because the exception must be old-style
classes or derived from BaseException.

Change-Id: I5b4dba6e53e6b6fef1a3fec469d370a6e010f232
Closes-Bug: #1533083

subject: Added a new nova CLI command "nova delete-all"

Although it can be achieve by shell script, But you need to write shell script. Here Idea is to add new command that will ease admin work for deleting VMs in one go.'}, {'account_id': 23886, 'date': '2016-11-05 05:57:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> I'm against this because it can be trivially achieved with a shell
 > script for loop, something like this (maybe with some extra
 > filtering to remove the header lines from the nova list output):
 > 
 > for vm in `nova list | cut -d' ' -f2`; do nova delete $vm; done

Idea of having this enhancement in nova-client itself rather than creating a separate script is to keeping inline with the existing implementation of other commands, also, this being the addition of a new nova command, it need to be in the nova-client only, moreover inclusion of a separate script for filtering out the VMs  doesn't seem appropriate to me."}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2016-11-05 15:48:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I still don't think we need 90 lines of Python (without tests, which you will need to add if this is to ever merge) for what can be done as a 1 or 2 line shell command. The one liner I wrote above literally replaces the proposed delete-all command, and if you want to exclude certain VMs that can be done with an extra grep:

for vm in `nova list | grep -v 'precious-vm' | cut -d' ' -f2`; do nova delete $vm; done

Still a 1-line shell for loop though."}, {'account_id': 23886, 'date': '2016-11-06 08:21:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> I still don't think we need 90 lines of Python (without tests,
 > which you will need to add if this is to ever merge) for what can
 > be done as a 1 or 2 line shell command. The one liner I wrote above
 > literally replaces the proposed delete-all command, and if you want
 > to exclude certain VMs that can be done with an extra grep:
 > 
 > for vm in `nova list | grep -v 'precious-vm' | cut -d' ' -f2`; do
 > nova delete $vm; done
 > 
 > Still a 1-line shell for loop though.

 > I still don't think we need 90 lines of Python (without tests,
 > which you will need to add if this is to ever merge) for what can
 > be done as a 1 or 2 line shell command. The one liner I wrote above
 > literally replaces the proposed delete-all command, and if you want
 > to exclude certain VMs that can be done with an extra grep:
 > 
 > for vm in `nova list | grep -v 'precious-vm' | cut -d' ' -f2`; do
 > nova delete $vm; done
 > 
 > Still a 1-line shell for loop though.

There are few points that need to be taken care of:
1). What if user enters the mix of VM name and VM ID, for example: 
nova delete-all --exclude <vn-name> <vm-id>
2). With the solution suggested by you, there need to be added a new shell script file in nova-client. Will this be fine ?
3). This shell script need to be invoked from the shell.py file of nova-client. Is this allowable? 
4). What if "nova list" returns more than 1 VM with same name and user need to delete 1 of them and need to guard other one.

Please suggest.
Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2016-11-06 16:14:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> What if user enters the mix of VM name and VM ID, for example: 
> nova delete-all --exclude <vn-name> <vm-id>

This can be done with grep in a couple of ways:
for vm in `nova list | grep -v 'vm-name' | | grep -v 'vm-id' | cut -d' ' -f2`; do nova delete $vm; done
for vm in `nova list | grep -vE '(vm-id|vm-name)' | cut -d' ' -f2`; do nova delete $vm; done

> With the solution suggested by you, there need to be added a new shell script file in nova-client.
> Will this be fine ?

Nothing is added to the Nova client, it's a shell command that the user issues on his laptop/workstation/whatever.

> This shell script need to be invoked from the shell.py file of nova-client. Is this allowable?

See above. Nothing is added to the client.

> What if "nova list" returns more than 1 VM with same name and user need to delete 1 of them and need to
> guard other one.

Then they filter by id like above.'}, {'account_id': 23886, 'date': '2016-11-06 18:06:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

1). With the suggested command above, it will going to work only when we use some kind of segregation between VM name and VM id.
Could you please suggested some way for this, when a user enters a VM name and VM id, how we can detect whether the given argument is a name or id?

2). Here we want the user to invoke a command, not the script.
If you beleive that we should you a script, can we workout a way to invoke that script from the shell.py file of nova-client, because user has to run this as a nova cli command which can then internally invoke a shell script, one way can be using os.system() or subprocess.call() function.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2016-11-06 19:57:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> With the suggested command above, it will going to work only
> when we use some kind of segregation between VM name and VM id.
> Could you please suggested some way for this, when a user enters
> a VM name and VM id, how we can detect whether the given argument
> is a name or id?

We don't have to detect anything, grep matches lines based on text, it doesn't know anything about VMs or names or IDs. The -v option does a reverse match, ie it makes grep output only the lines that don't match. I could have said:

for vm in `nova list | grep -v 'fish' | | grep -v 'vm-id' | cut -d' ' -f2`; do nova delete $vm; done

Any line that matches 'fish' in the nova list output will get filtered out. Do you know how pipes and grep work in a Unix shell?

> 2). Here we want the user to invoke a command, not the script.

I disagree with this. There should be no delete-all command in the Nova client, period. If a user wants to delete all their VMs, they can do with with the shell commands I have mentioned previously."}, {'account_id': 23886, 'date': '2016-11-07 07:37:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> We don't have to detect anything, grep matches lines based on text,
 > it doesn't know anything about VMs or names or IDs. The -v option
 > does a reverse match, ie it makes grep output only the lines that
 > don't match. I could have said:
 > 
 > for vm in `nova list | grep -v 'fish' | | grep -v 'vm-id' | cut -d'
 > ' -f2`; do nova delete $vm; done
 > 
 > Any line that matches 'fish' in the nova list output will get
 > filtered out. Do you know how pipes and grep work in a Unix shell?
 > 

Let me put this with an example:
suppose we have 2 VMs with same name as follows:

root@node-1:~# nova list
+--------------------------------------+------+--------+------------+-------------+----------------------------------+
| ID                                   | Name | Status | Task State | Power State | Networks                         |
+--------------------------------------+------+--------+------------+-------------+----------------------------------+
| 6b782203-c002-4e07-9045-a0a579d8ce2f | vm1  | ACTIVE | -          | Running     | admin_internal_net=192.168.111.3 |
| f932b52a-920a-4172-b936-031ec03cddac | vm1  | ACTIVE | -          | Running     | admin_internal_net=192.168.111.4 |
+--------------------------------------+------+--------+------------+-------------+----------------------------------+

Now i want to delete one of the VM, vm1.

when i execute the shell script, if i entered the vm name i.e vm1 then it will exclude both VMs and will not delete any VM, which is not the expected behavior.
In this case, i should get a message something like: "use VM-ID instead of VM-NAME as the there are multiple VMs with this VM name".


 > I disagree with this. There should be no delete-all command in the
 > Nova client, period. If a user wants to delete all their VMs, they
 > can do with with the shell commands I have mentioned previously.

In that case the bug #1587748 need to be mark as invalid and need to be converted into a blueprint.
Infact, it should have been a blueprint anyway.

Here, Idea is to expose a user-friendly command to the user for deleting all expect special VMs.
Which can be something like this:

root@node-1:~# nova help delete-all
usage: nova delete-all [--host <hostname>] [--all-tenants]
                       [--exclude <server_name> [<server_name> ...]]

Immediately shut down and delete all server(s). Excluded server(s) are not
deleted.

Optional arguments:
  --host <hostname>             Delete all servers hosted by the specified
                                hostname(Admin only).
  --all-tenants                 Delete server(s) in another tenant by name
                                (Admin only).
  --exclude <server_name> [<server_name> ...]
                                name or ID of the server(s) to be excluded
                                from deletion.

As an Openstack user i will always look for some commands for tasks like : "nova list", "nova delete", etc.
i will never look for any script for my tasks.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2016-11-07 09:24:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Literally the first link when I Google 'nova delete all vms':

https://ask.openstack.org/en/question/47853/how-to-delete-multiple-instances-bulk-delete-via-curl-or-cli/"}, {'account_id': 23886, 'date': '2016-11-07 10:00:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Literally the first link when I Google 'nova delete all vms':
 > 
 > https://ask.openstack.org/en/question/47853/how-to-delete-multiple-instances-bulk-delete-via-curl-or-cli/


Yes, this can possibly be a workaround but not including various scenarios which can result in unexpected behavior and can cause accidental termination of VMs as well.
What if a user enters two VMs for guarding, one with VM-name and other with VM-ID, these 2 VMs can be same or different VMs, there can be other scenarios which can be thought of.
Such script can not be reusable, each user has to be competent in shell scripting for using this as per his/her requirement.
Instead, here we are trying to provide a user friendly solution, commonly available to each user.
Also, mentioned previously, as a user it's always easier for me, if i get a cli command for my tasks."}, {'account_id': 24101, 'date': '2016-11-07 10:18:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

Changes look good to me.
This command would be a good interface for a user who does not have much knowledge of shell scripting or any other scripting language. User can leave all the validation job on this command. Also from openstack perspective, a user will always look for a command rather than a script to do an operation. I personally feel that commands are easy to find rather than scripts. Also if we have a command, rather than each user making their own scripts, we can achieve re-usability. At the same time, I think the Creater and Developer in this bug would want this to be as generic as possible so that even of this command existing, user still won't have to write script to achieve certain delete-all functionality."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2016-11-07 16:43:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)

This implementation seems far too complex.  Also, there are no tests; that needs to be fixed.  Finally, I'd like to see an analysis of whether it makes sense to put this functionality into the "nova delete" command, i.e., adding a "--all" flag to that command, along with an optional "--exclude" flag.'}, {'account_id': 23886, 'date': '2016-11-08 05:20:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4'}, {'account_id': 23886, 'date': '2016-11-08 05:21:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(7 comments)'}, {'account_id': 23886, 'date': '2016-11-08 05:22:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23886, 'date': '2016-11-08 05:29:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> (8 comments)
 > 
 > This implementation seems far too complex.  Also, there are no
 > tests; that needs to be fixed.  Finally, I'd like to see an
 > analysis of whether it makes sense to put this functionality into
 > the "nova delete" command, i.e., adding a "--all" flag to that
 > command, along with an optional "--exclude" flag.

Yes, this implementation is little bit complex, as there are few points that need to be taken care of, like:
1. getting the list of all existing servers
2. fetching the details(Name and Id) of the servers from list in 1.
3. processing based on the VM-Name and/or VM-Id entered by the user for excluding them from being deleted.

Initially thought to add this implementation into the existing "nova delete" command implemantion only, using --all option, but this approach was making the code more complex and command less user friendly.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-11-08 06:09:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23886, 'date': '2016-11-14 14:05:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> (1 comment)

 "--all-tenants" is an option.

# nova list
+----+------+--------+------------+-------------+----------+
| ID | Name | Status | Task State | Power State | Networks |
+----+------+--------+------------+-------------+----------+
+----+------+--------+------------+-------------+----------+

When user enters the following command with "--all-tenants" :

    nova delete-all --exclude n1 n2 --all-tenants

Output:

    Server n1 doesn't exist
    Server n2 doesn't exist
    There are no servers to delete

*** Here "--all-tenants" is treated as option in the command.

When user enters the following command with "all-tenants" :

    nova delete-all --exclude n1 n2 all-tenants

Output:

    Server n1 doesn't exist
    Server n2 doesn't exist
    Server all-tenants doesn't exist
    There are no servers to delete

*** Here "all-tenants" is treated as server name in the command since it is used without "--".'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2016-11-15 16:30:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Good, so argparse does the right thing.  However, that's not my point; my point is that usage is ambiguous _in the mind of the user_, and that's why I would like to see "nargs='+'" dropped on that option.'}, {'account_id': 23886, 'date': '2016-11-16 11:26:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> Good, so argparse does the right thing.  However, that's not my
 > point; my point is that usage is ambiguous _in the mind of the
 > user_, and that's why I would like to see "nargs='+'" dropped on
 > that option.

Got your point.
But still am of the opinion that, say, for guarding 10 server i would not like to write "--exclude" 10 times like "--exclude=server1 --exclude=server2 ... --exclude=server10", rather, i would prefer to write "--exclude" only once and mention the servers name thereafter like "--exclude server1 server2 ... server10".

Can't we be little flexible here in terms of optional argument usage!!'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2016-11-16 15:53:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Well, the other option you mentioned not wanting to use is comma-separated; afaik, commas cannot appear in IDs or in names, so that would be one way of addressing the issue.  A comma-separated argument here would be fine by me, but I really have strong opinions against using "nargs='+'" on an option.  If you can get other cores to go along with you on this change as-is, I'll abstain and let it go through, but otherwise, I want to see "nargs='+'" eliminated.'}, {'account_id': 23886, 'date': '2016-11-17 06:11:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> Well, the other option you mentioned not wanting to use is
 > comma-separated; afaik, commas cannot appear in IDs or in names, so
 > that would be one way of addressing the issue.  A comma-separated
 > argument here would be fine by me, but I really have strong
 > opinions against using "nargs='+'" on an option.  If you can get
 > other cores to go along with you on this change as-is, I'll abstain
 > and let it go through, but otherwise, I want to see "nargs='+'"
 > eliminated.

I have rechecked, we cannot use comma(',') separated option.

for example:

When using "append" instead of "nagrs"

command entered:
================

    ~$ nova delete-all --exclude vm1,vm2

using above command, List of excluded servers = [u'vm1,vm2']

This usage creates the server name as : 'vm1,vm2' => this will never be there in the list of existing VMs. Though, internally we can extract the servers' name from this list.

Moreover, the usage while using "append" which the user will see is not comma-separated.

~$ nova help delete-all 
usage: nova delete-all [--host <hostname>] [--all-tenants]
                       [--exclude <server_name>]

Immediately shut down and delete all server(s). Excluded server(s) are not
deleted.

Optional arguments:
  --host <hostname>        Delete all servers hosted by the specified hostname
                           (Admin only).
  --all-tenants            Delete server(s) in another tenant by name (Admin
                           only).
  --exclude <server_name>  Name or ID of the server(s) to be excluded from
                           deletion.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2016-11-17 16:22:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

If you use comma-separated, you would not use "action='append'"; you would use the default action ("store") and then do a .split(',') on the value.'}, {'account_id': 23886, 'date': '2016-11-21 05:39:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> If you use comma-separated, you would not use "action='append'";
 > you would use the default action ("store") and then do a
 > .split(',') on the value.

done'}, {'account_id': 23886, 'date': '2016-11-21 05:40:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Published edit on patch set 7'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-11-21 12:02:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Verified+1

commit_message:
Added a new nova CLI command "nova delete-all"

This command will allow us to delete all VMs/Servers under a particular tenant
or all tenants without giving the name of each VM/Server.
Also we can guard required VMs/Servers using "--exclude" option.

Command Usage/help is as follws:

~$ nova help delete-all
usage: nova delete-all [--host <hostname>] [--all-tenants]
                       [--exclude <server_name> [<server_name> ...]]

Immediately shut down and delete all server(s). Excluded server(s) are not
deleted.

Optional arguments:
  --host <hostname>             Delete all servers hosted by the specified
                                hostname (Admin only).
  --all-tenants                 Delete server(s) in another tenant by name
                                (Admin only).
  --exclude <server_name> [<server_name> ...]
                                name or ID of the server(s) to be excluded
                                from deletion.

Closes-Bug: #1587748

Change-Id: I228dc7eeb92f13c2d8be11dfaff9e9589f0b41b7

- gate-novaclient-dsvm-functional-neutron http://logs.openstack.org/11/395011/4/check/gate-novaclient-dsvm-functional-neutron/5f007ce/ : SUCCESS in 37m 49s'}, {'account_id': 22771, 'date': '2016-11-09 15:40:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

While it may complicate things, what about a change that instead of limiting to names/IDs in one delete command, we change it to check each one by one. Basically delete the first object given (either by ID or name) then update the list and delete the next one. So in your second case described in the bugfix after the first one with the ID is deleted, the list would be updated and when trying to delete with the name 'vm1' it would be the only one remaining so it too would be deleted."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2016-11-09 16:33:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

I'm still not happy with this, even after reviewing the bug.  I think the first thing to do, though, is to pull the resolution of the list of IDs and names out into a separate function, since you also need to do that for your "delete-all" command.  (Even if you merge that into "delete", you would want that function to avoid code duplication within the do_delete() function.)  The function should probably have one argument regarding whether to allow ambiguity (allow turning "name" into multiple instances) or not; you would want to allow the ambiguity for an --exclude option, but not for a "delete" command.  I would still expect to see a mix of ID and name.'}, {'account_id': 23886, 'date': '2016-11-14 13:42:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4'}, {'account_id': 23886, 'date': '2016-11-14 13:44:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Published edit on patch set 5'}, {'account_id': 23886, 'date': '2016-11-14 13:46:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Published edit on patch set 6'}, {'account_id': 23886, 'date': '2016-11-14 13:49:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)

I have tried with an alternate solution, where a delay of 10 seconds is introduced between each delete request, which will resolve this bug by allowing the database to update the existing number of VMs before new delete request.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-11-14 14:52:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-python-novaclient-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/11/395011/7/check/gate-python-novaclient-docs-ubuntu-xenial/d6c8d89//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 59s
- gate-python-novaclient-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/11/395011/7/check/gate-python-novaclient-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/f4b4c9a/ : SUCCESS in 1m 28s
- gate-python-novaclient-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/11/395011/7/check/gate-python-novaclient-python27-ubuntu-xenial/dfde7c0/ : SUCCESS in 6m 16s
- gate-python-novaclient-python34 http://logs.openstack.org/11/395011/7/check/gate-python-novaclient-python34/a861801/ : SUCCESS in 4m 44s
- gate-python-novaclient-python35-nv http://logs.openstack.org/11/395011/7/check/gate-python-novaclient-python35-nv/e5db664/ : SUCCESS in 5m 33s (non-voting)
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-python-novaclient http://logs.openstack.org/11/395011/7/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-python-novaclient/6fa27f5/ : SUCCESS in 40m 51s
- gate-novaclient-dsvm-functional-mitaka-nv http://logs.openstack.org/11/395011/7/check/gate-novaclient-dsvm-functional-mitaka-nv/30fcdac/ : SUCCESS in 25m 26s (non-voting)
- gate-novaclient-dsvm-functional-identity-v3-only-nv http://logs.openstack.org/11/395011/7/check/gate-novaclient-dsvm-functional-identity-v3-only-nv/adf2a21/ : SUCCESS in 1h 06m 04s (non-voting)
- gate-novaclient-dsvm-functional-neutron http://logs.openstack.org/11/395011/7/check/gate-novaclient-dsvm-functional-neutron/2601087/ : SUCCESS in 1h 05m 51s'}, {'account_id': 22771, 'date': '2016-11-14 14:53:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

Looks fine to me, but not sure if others will have a problem with a 10 second sleep. Need more reviews.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2016-11-15 16:35:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

I am not happy with introducing a 10 second sleep.  Now you've taken that potential race and made it so nova will winbut only much of the time.  I agree, though, that more reviews are needed"}, {'account_id': 23886, 'date': '2016-11-16 07:45:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

> I am not happy with introducing a 10 second sleep.  Now you've
 > taken that potential race and made it so nova will winbut only
 > much of the time.  I agree, though, that more reviews are needed

Here, i tried to delay the request sent for server deletion by 10 seconds (5 seconds not seems to be enough), and, not blocking any request, be it is for deletion or any other.

Just Delaying. Not Blocking.

So, i can't see any race condition here."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2016-11-16 15:56:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

The race condition comes if nova happens to take longer than 10 seconds to process the delete, which it might in busier installations than you've so far experimented with.  In fact, the fact that you found 5 seconds inadequate highlights the race condition.  Now, I consider it a minor race, since I don't consider this bug to be all that criticalmore of a minor interface inconsistencybut a 10 second delay just to work around the race most of the time seems like a bad tradeoff to me."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-11-16 15:37:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-11-16 15:37:02.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Fix inconsistent behaviour of "nova delete".

Introduced a delay of 10 seconds between each delete request.

Closes-Bug: #1640089

Change-Id: I084a7088e2b8151b90795db1128118e257f22066

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-15 17:24:41.000000000', 'message': "Switch tripleo-ci scenario001 to non-voting

We're seeing excessive amount of failures on this job due what appears
to be a performance regression. As this has been an on-going issue for
over a week, we need to temporarily switch scenario001 to non-voting
while we continue to troubleshoot.  This change should be reverted ASAP
when the cause is identified and fixed.

Change-Id: Iabc01eb763428765436211be9e600cc59fce400e
Related-Bug: #1731063
"}]
commit_message:
Switch tripleo-ci scenario001 to non-voting

We're seeing excessive amount of failures on this job due what appears
to be a performance regression. As this has been an on-going issue for
over a week, we need to temporarily switch scenario001 to non-voting
while we continue to troubleshoot.  This change should be reverted ASAP
when the cause is identified and fixed.

Change-Id: Iabc01eb763428765436211be9e600cc59fce400e
Related-Bug: #1731063

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 04:16:54.000000000', 'message': 'Move copy-wheels roles to post-run

Currently, our secrets are not included in the
build-wheel-mirror-base, so this means we cannot access the afs secret
to copy files into /afs/.openstack.org. Move this into pre distro jobs
where the secret lives.

Again, once we have protected final jobs, we can clean this up a bit.

Change-Id: I8e8b92af771bc84a3930a8f98c96c8216388d1cf
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Move copy-wheels roles to post-run

Currently, our secrets are not included in the
build-wheel-mirror-base, so this means we cannot access the afs secret
to copy files into /afs/.openstack.org. Move this into pre distro jobs
where the secret lives.

Again, once we have protected final jobs, we can clean this up a bit.

Change-Id: I8e8b92af771bc84a3930a8f98c96c8216388d1cf
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add irrelevant-files to openstack-tox-functional*

Adds these irrelevant files to openstack-tox-functional and
openstack-tox-functional-py35, since they don't affect the
functional tests:
  - ^.*\.rst$
  - ^doc/.*$
  - ^releasenotes/.*$

Change-Id: I56b4765bb4f350cc5a5e87e781614973bfcf9316

For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2017-06-26 15:28:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

1. I'm not sure we care.  A negative value for wrap is currently treated like a 0 value, which I think is just fine.  I have to note, though, that the way your change is written isn't treating 0 properly, however, and that is a bug you will need to fix.

2. Elastic Recheck is wrong about the unit test failures being a known bug; those are actually a typo on your part.

3. The functional test failure is probably (I haven't looked to verify) due to a problem that is currently being debugged, so I wouldn't worry too much about that right now.

4. If we do decide to go forward with this change, I would expect an added test to verify that ValueError is being raised at the right time."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2017-07-12 09:26:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Fixed wrap argument to accept only non-negative values

Wrap argument is accepting negative values. This fix will throw error
for negative values as "Wrap argument should be a non-negative
integer".

Change-Id: I514ffe48cc24a5eb2f1b2151db2344b90c9e61b5

commit_message:
Add Docker service to the undercloud roles

This patch adds the Docker service to the default undercloud
roles data. By default Docker is set to OS::Heat::None.
When using environments/docker.yaml however it will get set
to puppet/service/docker.yaml which will facilitate installing
the Docker service early in the deployment at step 1.

Change-Id: I2d569eef136254dc81bdee93a7869fd361a8400d

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-15 21:56:31.000000000', 'message': "Don't re-propose translation changes that already exist.

Previously Gerrit would reject changes that were basically duplicates.
So when we submitted a duplicate translation change it would not get
accepted. The new version of Gerrit now accepts these duplicates which
causes an excessive amount of patches to be posted.

Change the behavior so that know it will only propose a translation
change when there is an actual change compared to previous proposed
patches.

Change-Id: I1d94852265ba5898f7c0fd312221df7c469a5a25
"}]
commit_message:
Don't re-propose translation changes that already exist.

Previously Gerrit would reject changes that were basically duplicates.
So when we submitted a duplicate translation change it would not get
accepted. The new version of Gerrit now accepts these duplicates which
causes an excessive amount of patches to be posted.

Change the behavior so that know it will only propose a translation
change when there is an actual change compared to previous proposed
patches.

Change-Id: I1d94852265ba5898f7c0fd312221df7c469a5a25

you need to update zuul/layout.yaml as well. This change will only define jobs but not run anything.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-12 06:29:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-10-29 14:11:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

We have switched to Zuul v3 now, this change does not apply anymore.

Learn on how to update your change with Zuul v3 at
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html .

Simplified:
* Job definitions can be in-repo; common job definitions are in
  openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs repository
* Job scheduling can be done in-repo for project specific changes,
  common jobs are configured via
  openstack-infra/project-config/zuul.d/projects.yaml

Read the above mentioned document for finer details.

Please decide whether this change is still needed and then adopt if
for Zuul v3 or abandon it.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2017-11-16 08:42:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-11-16 09:10:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Avoid default mutable values in arguments

Mutable values shouldn't be used as default values in function
arguments [1].

[1] http://docs.python-guide.org/en/latest/writing/gotchas/

Change-Id: I25774e634d1489059225af545f780d8a285decef

subject: DNM: Check gARP patch in OVN
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 11:51:22.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Check gARP patch in OVN

We want to test this commit [0] which makes ovn-controller
send both gARP request and reply packets to make sure that
the correct MAC is learnt for router gateway ports and VIFs.

Co-Authored-By: Miguel Angel Ajo <majopela@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ie9c599bfafb5e3bb9b52df54e320c7149f75f021
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
DNM: Check gARP patch in OVN

We want to test this commit [0] which makes ovn-controller
send both gARP request and reply packets to make sure that
the correct MAC is learnt for router gateway ports and VIFs.

Co-Authored-By: Miguel Angel Ajo <majopela@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ie9c599bfafb5e3bb9b52df54e320c7149f75f021
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove bogus and unneeded role from job definition

We get the devstack roles for free since we're using the devstack job as
a parent. Also, the repo location was incorrect anyway.

Change-Id: I75842ff0bb28ffed7336cf77ea9535ece9e67dc3
